description:
Came here with my friend who was visiting me from Austin. It was our first time and we loved the place 
The food was really good and we had mimos which were refreshing and amazing 
Must try!
author: Kavya B.

description:
We've all gone out on blind dates, and if you haven't, find someone who will set you up with one.

Trust me, it's a crap shoot.  Just like what Forrest Gump said, you never know what you'll get.

I trusted my lunch companion without checking out the reviews.  I ordered the burger, which was just about perfection. Just about...but it would be great if I could have had the onion strings instead of the salad.

Service could be better...I mean much better.  Please don't come to my table wearing last night's scowl; remember I'm paying your way through college.  I'll come back for another burger, but service has to step it up.
author: Ron L.

description:
I really like this place.  It's intimate and has great service.  The 2nd time around, I was able to try more dishes.  The best thing I had was the housemade ricotta.  Please note that you can ask for more crackers.

The baby back ribs and cornbread were really dry.  I was a little disappointed because, although good, the texture was not great.

My fiance and his dad ordered the burger and they seemed to love it.  I also noticed that many others ordered the burger.  Maybe I'll try that next time.
author: Rachel L.

description: Boring burger. It wasn't cooked to my desire, also lacking flavor and the egg was overcooked. My friend enjoyed the Chilaquiles. I didn't like my Bloody Mary and had a difficult time finishing it. Others talked highly about their burger so I was disappointed. Granted I didn't have cheese or a bun but I've still had better elsewhere.
author: Jen L.

description: So good - dog friendly with heaters outside.  Frankie was our awesome waitress and the food was really good. The burger is the best - double patty and the short onion rings are the tastiest I've ever had.  You don't even need fries.  The ricotta and honey with the grilled shishito peppers were a perfect pairing as recommended by Frankie.  I'd definitely come back - we had a great time!
author: Chris L.

description:
Im not usually in this part of town but I had a great time here. Iv been on a quest to try all of the bays top burgers and this was possibly my favorite. 

It has a nice atmosphere first of all and great service. Some rude ass lady and her yuppie family cut me in line but the friendly waitress swooped in and found me a good seat. The whole menu looked good but I was here on a mission and had to try the famous burger. 

The burger blew my mind! It was huge juicy had 2 patties cheese lettuce pickels onion and house sauce. I opted to add on the bacon but not the avocado and try it more traditional this time tho I would have liked an egg option as well. I also really liked the side of crispy onions(think green bean casserole topping but fresh and homemade). 

Possibly the bays best burger easily top 3 and great service. This is currently the best place iv been to in the marina area and highly recommend it.
author: Sean G.

description:
BEST BURGER IN SF!

Ok when I was taken here to hear that this would be the best burger in the city, I was a but of a skeptic.. the lady next to me at the bar overheard my order and she tapped my shoulder "did I just hear you order the burger? I'm so jealous! I didn't get it this time.." I let her know I was new in SF and it was my first time there- she's lived in SF her whole life and a regular at Causwell's. She too reaffirmed that it was the best burger in town- handsdown. So a lot of pressure on this burger.. and it did not dissapoint!

DEVILED EGGS- I love me some deviled eggs and these did not disappoint either! Rich creamy and full of flavor. What more could you want in a deviled egg? Hack: Comes with 5, but you can add on extra ones to even out the portion for your group.

BURGER- I added bacon to mine because I couldn't help it. I nearly added avo too but I didn't want to over do it. The patty was almost the opposite of in-n-out in its consistency but very similar in flavor I thought. The patty was uneven crumbles of ground meat that was seared to juicy perfection. It was slightly over-cooked than medium rare imo, but still amazingly scrumptious! The fried onion strings were a delicious crunchy flavorful addition too! I wouldn't sub fries for this (i almost did) because the onion strings are so good!! I got a side of fries but it was almost unnecessary.. the side of garlic aoili was bomb though if you can manage to get that on the side of your onion strings.

I will definitely be craving this burger and be back for more!
author: Nina M.

description: Food is ok, nothing to really rave about.  Had the Chilaquiles that had way too much tortilla and not enough eggs.  Service is awful.  Came here on a Sunday, wasn't too crowded.  We were seated immediately, couple next to us was seated a few moments later.  Took their drink order first, no big deal.  Took our order next, all i had was a coffee, nothing complicated.  The table next to us gets their drinks and their appetizers.  5 mins go by, still no coffee.  Another 5 minutes still no coffee and no one has come by to take our food order.  Finally had to wave someone down.  Takes our order and I ask for my coffee that should have been served 10 min ago.  Coffee finally arrives, filled only half way, and cold.  No sugar and creamer in sight.  So at this point I am annoyed that I have to go flag someone down yet again.  Definitely not coming back here and not recommending to my friends.
author: Zarlasht H.

description:
Always heard about Causwells having a great burger so I came by to try it. The Americana burger was legit, super delicious. Perfectly melted cheese between the double flat juicy patties on a bed of sliced pickles and onions, all contained within a soft bun. The salad it comes with has a light vinaigrette. Meh, didn't care for that. A good burger needs some fries! I also had the deviled eggs which were awesome! Super creamy and with a bit of salmon on top.

Seating feels a bit cramped. I sat outside and you're literally sitting a foot away from other diners. Service was okay, just gave the standard service you'd expect. Prices here are moderate, but the burger is rather expensive. It was delicious but $16-20 is pushing my personal limit of a good burger.

Food: 4.5/5
Value: 3/5
Service: 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Brian G.

description: Usually LOVE their food. This delivery was not as good as usual. The beef dip did not have the au jus with it. Traditionally, beef dips come with side of au jus for dipping. the burger did not have as much pickle as usual. No big deal there. but, a bit more consistency would be nice. otherwise, I'm a big fan of Causwells and Popsons. I will continue to reccomend and order from them regularly
author: Amber S.

description:
Wow, this place really knows how to make a burger! Found out about this place while reading an article about the top 25 burger places in SF, and decided to give it a shot. 

It's a small little place, but it's SF.  There aren't that many places that can accommodate a larger number of people.  They have some really great beers here and I tried Dragon's Milk which might have been the best stout I've ever had.  The burger here was simply fantastic, despite them not being able to make it medium rare.  The only reason why I'm not giving this place five stars is that the waitress seemed to be a bit confused with few things.  

Overall, in a city with more restaurants that you know what to do with, this is a great little spot.  Would come here again in a heartbeat.
author: Benny H.

description: I was really eager to come try the hash I see in pictures but they didn't have it in the menu! It was replaced with smoked pulled pork tots. The pulled pork and everything was good but you can't compare fried tater tots to potatoes so I was a bit disappointed. I'm willing to come back and order the deviled eggs or burger everyone else is talking about though! Service was nice + attentive and there is ample seating.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Decided to come here for brunch with my friend who lives in the city. I called to see how long of a wait it would be to sit 4 people. The person said they'd be able to seat us right away. I arrived 10 mins later & asked for a table for 4 outside. A waitress asked me if I had a reservation & I said no & she just turned & walked inside the restaurant without saying a word. When she walked back out I told her about my phone conversation & she replied "Um ok. But you still need to wait. You can see none of the tables are ready." All they had to do was put two tables together & there was a much better way of saying that they just needed a 30 seconds to put the tables together so I was already annoyed but the food looked great so I wanted to stay. My friend ordered the biscuits & gravy & my boyfriend & I shared the chilaquiles & pulled pork tots. My favorite was the pulled pork from the pulled pork tots. Unfortunately I was only able to eat about half the dish since it was just sitting in a pool of oil. The biscuits were pretty good but a bit burnt on the bottom. It came with a lot of gravy so if that's your thing, this is for you! The chilaquiles were also good & the chips stayed pretty crispy for a long time.
author: Ashlee T.

description: Greatest burger!! Juicy juicy juicy! Anytime we are in the Marina area we always try to get to Causwells for their burger!
author: Alexa O.

description:
My younger daughter and I love to pop in here to have a burger.

A thick, juicy burger with everything you want or do not want on it. 

Service is friendly and unrushed.

The space itself is intimate so be prepared to wait and squish by people to get you butt in the seat. 

No fuss, delicious burger for mother daughter date before we go across the street for dessert and then walk and shop along the street. 

Parking can be anxiety riddled, but if You score a spot? Do what we do. Walk and shop along Chestnut street!
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Made a reservation so able to get a table for 9 outside.
Nice brunch menu and good food, although they were out of three things we ordered. Food didn't come out together so we waited a little to be polite, but then started eating since it was chilly outside.
We had some nice drinks, I really liked the Salty Dog (without the salt so...Greyhound). I had the Veggie Hash (they were out of pork). After adding a little hot sauce it was good. Heard the burgers and chilaquiles were good too.
author: Susan K.

description:
This place was ok. Nothing mind blowing. But ok.
We were seated at a "community" table...on a Thursday night. Annoying? Yes. But no biggie I guess. Just a little antisocial is all.
Menu is small and limited.
Got the house made ricotta. Considering everyone raved about it....figured I'd try it. It had an odd taste of lemon cleaner to it. Really REALLY weird. Not a fan. Wouldn't recommend.
The Roasted Veggies entree was tasty. And obviously the burger was good as well.
Overall...just an ok place. If you're looking for a quick dinner place, give it a try.
author: Ramona P.

description:
My husband and son loves themselves some cheeseburgers, so I find myself eating them quite often. Their "Americana Burger" is truly an awesome burger. I love the crispy burger patty and the gooey american cheese. I added bacon to mine cause, why not?!?
Their deviled eggs are also super good. It with smoked salmon and herbs. They are cooked perfectly I might add. 
You also can't go wrong with their wine list, delicious!
author: Kristina C.

description:
Really great spot! The burger was incredibly delicious and the crispy chicken sandwich was fantastic (I added avocado and they were nice enough to add provolone even though they normally wouldn't ). 

The bread the sandwiches came on was fresh, the fries were tasty, and the side salad was simple yet yummy. 

Service was a tad slow but the poor gal was there by herself and she was still doing a great job.

Overall, highly recommended and we'll definitely come back next time we visit The City
author: Victor N.

description:
If you're looking for a great spot to grab a drink with a friend in the Marina, this place is great. Drinks are reasonably priced (except wine, but it's overpriced everywhere at restaurants/bars) but the atmosphere is relaxed, which I appreciate. 

I didn't get any food but it looks good. 

I haven't been during the day, but it's always packed with folks sitting outside on nice days. Reminds me very much of European style restaurants, which is great. 

My big plus for this place was the bartender. She was super nice and let me try and few of the beers which I had never heard of. We were there towards the end of close and even topped off my beer at no charge. I appreciate that and it will result in me frequenting this spot, not in the expectation of free drinks but the fact that they do things like that for customers sometimes.
author: Matt M.

description:
A Host should be gracious, considerate, kind, and welcoming. Everything the girl that met me at the door was not. But besides her, was my craving for a burger satisfied? No. Why? Well, due to the awful greeting by the hostess today, I forgot to tell her I like my burgers medium rare. Which by the way is supposed to be a key question you should take note of when someone orders a burger from you...Instead I received a Luke warm, cold bun, well done burger which was sitting for some time because the girl in the blue shirt must have figured I didn't pretip...thankfully a co-worker told me about it so Ik to eat it right away. 

Will I return? Hell to the nah nah nah. Glad I didn't tip. Money down the drain...
author: Asia S.

description:
Came in with a reservation for brunch. Waited 20 minutes just to meet our server. After about 10-15 minutes we were asking who our server was, as other tables had service and we still didn't have water or anything. Additionally, the restaurant wasn't even close to full. The four tables around us were empty and people who were working were just standing around; they definitely didn't seem busy. This was disappointing because I brought two friends who were from out of town.

I ordered the pulled pork hash. It came with a poached egg, onion, and radish. It seemed to be lacking substance and flavor. My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy. The biscuit was burnt on the bottom. It was so burnt the bottom was charred black. 

Hopefully next time, I'll have a better experience!
author: Julie L.

description:
Ordered Market Veg Hash. Poached egg was cooked for at least 20 minutes. It's not just a hard boiled egg. It's cooked to kill anything in it. Vegetables: two small pieces of cauliflower, two slices of radishes and the rest are potatoes.   Extremely greasy potatoes.  Waitress never came to ask how it was.
Close to the time I was done she did come and asked-too late. However, they were trying to fix it.
author: Lem I.

description:
Causwells is one of those spots where you can expect great food, drink and service every time. Situated on the west end of chestnut st., this spot always has a great vibe, outdoor seating and a great bar to post up during all hours of the day. 

The beer/wine list is one of my favorite parts aside from the awesome salads and well known burger. If I could recommend a few menu items, they would be: the burger, deviled eggs, and beet salad. 

I popped in this past Saturday for a lunch and found myself seated at the inside bar having a glass of rosé wine and the beet salad. Both excellent! 

The restaurant itself was pretty dead due in part to burning man and some other festivals so it was a nice calm lunch :)
author: Benjamin F.

description:
There is only one word to describe the burger here, Heaven! In fact it's PURE Heaven. The beef is juicy, the salad fresh and crispy, the bun soft and it holds everything together perfect. That first bite just sends your tastebuds tingling with joy.

Such a pleasure to have been able to eat here.

The staff were also great, very accommodating and made the dining experience that little bit better too.

If only I didn't have to leave SF
author: Kay G.

description: This is a great spot in the Marina District. We stumbled upon it after searching on Yelp!, and it didn't disappoint. As we approached, the place was packed, which is a good sign in a city with such a good scene. Our food was great. There was plenty of balance and flavor with what we had. The prices were fair for what we got. And the ambiance of the place was great even though it was a smaller place.
author: Scott H.

description:
I didn't expect much from this place when we went there a couple of weekends ago for brunch with friends, but I was pleasantly surprised.

The waiter was friendly and a little quirky, kind of perfect for a Sunday brunch involving boozy drinks. My drink? I got he sake and grapefruit cocktail... I'm still not sure how to explain it... I'm pretty neutral, I may have liked it, but I didn't hate it. 

I got the classic- poached eggs with potatoes and bacon ( no toast/ because I'm glutenfree). The eggs were poached well. I read reviews of the potatoes being too soft. They were fine, I wish they more crunchier, but still enjoyable.

I usually don't eat pork, but the bacon was actually pretty yummy. Also, the table got the ricotta and honey with bread. I took a spoon of the honey and ricotta before the bread touched it and it was delicious! It was a hit with our table.
author: Gita r.

description:
Causwells has been featured in almost every local foodie magazine for their burgers.  It just so happened that today, wifey wanted a burger.  I wanted beer.  We made a quick reservation on open table and headed over to get our grub on.  Parking is usually difficult to find in this area so Lyft out or walk if you can.  

Anyhoo, we had such an awesome experience here.  Our server was super nice, had personality, and a sense of humor.  Always a plus when you're dining anywhere in the fast moving environment that we live in.  We got there late in the afternoon/early evening so we made it just in time for their midday menu.  We were there for the burgers so we didn't care that they didn't have their dinner menu available.  

Currently, they are promoting their 3 year anniversary with a special birthday burger:  double patty with truffle cheese, bacon jam, french onion aioli, and arugula.  I was the proud owner of this burger and hoovered it without a problem.  

We also ordered their basic americana burger with avocado and bacon.  Both burgers were juicy, seasoned well, had great accompaniments and toppings.  My only complaint?  I didn't have the option of how I wanted my burger cooked.  Looked like the burger came out medium well.  I usually order my burger medium rare.  Juices were still running though as it was not dry whatsoever.  The bun was one of my favorite things about the burger.  Loved how soft it was but still kept its form to keep the burger together.  The fried onion thingies on the side are ridonk.  I could go to town on those onions but I was overly stuffed from the burger.  As for beer, we went with their draft IPA and saison.  Both delish.

Lastly, we went with the all star donut bread pudding.  Although it was alright, I probably don't need to order it again.  I felt like it was missing a fresh element.  Maybe some fruit?  

4.5 stars with the .5 deducted for the medium well patties.  Perfect if that's your thing though.
author: Jen W.

description:
Not gonna lie..this place has really amazing cheeseburgers! The staff is absolutely terrible though! I believe her name was Deb, she had blonde hair and she was extremely rude. they messed up my order twice. but! despite the terrible service the food is pretty good and I'd probably go back again. also, The french fries are a 10 out of 10 I like the french fries better than the onion crisps. 

Hope my review helped!
author: Amber R.

description:
I was in the neighborhood on Sunday and stopped in with a friend for a late brunch.  Every so often I get a craving for a burger, and I'd heard this was one of the best in SF... and I'm really just here to say, it is!

We arrived around 2pm and it was pretty busy, but we were able to snag seats at the bar without a wait.  I ordered the burger with avocado added and sauce on the side.  It was a HUGE burger -- two patties! -- served with a salad on the side with a delicious, tart dressing.  It's hard to pinpoint exactly what works about the burger, but it just works flawlessly: the cheese is melted just the right amount, it's juicy but you can eat it without making a huge mess, it's served at just the right doneness, and overall, the flavors are simple and comforting.

It's a pub/bar type ambience, and has a laid back vibe with friendly service.  Prices are not bad, either.
author: Christine G.

description: Love this place! Our favorites to get from Causwells are the Americana burger (add avo) and the Octopus small bites. Amazing. We always say this is the best burger you can get in the city! It has a secret Causwells sauce & the burger patty is hand made, yum! It reminds me of a gourmet version of the Big Mac. Must try!
author: Felicia A.

description: The house made ricotta with honey was exceptional. Additionally, the burger was  perfection - which my my husband and I split. Great selection of wine & beer as well. Fantastic and friendly service - nothing to complain about. :-)
author: Noel A.

description:
Went in for a Sunday brunch & shared 2 items:

Go for the burger  although it's weird salad and potatoes were the only side options, not French fries or onion rings . If this is all We ordered they'd get another star . It's big and juicy and cooked to perfection. We added the bacon but that made it an 18$ burger. We asked for the sauces on the side (causwells, mustard & ketchup) I recommend doing that!

The chilaquiles lacked flavor and just didn't really do it for us. I added some hot sauce but something was just missing even with the added chicken. 

They do have Mexican coke though and some good beer options
author: danielle a.

description:
Causwells is everything you'd expect for a hyped burger bistro in the Marina: comfort food dressed up in artsy presentation, in the backdrop of a rustic quasi-hipster ambiance. I even deliberately wore a Marina outfit (large shades, trendy coat, tall boots, and a pink sparkly clutch)--for funsies, and I ended up strangely feeling like I fit into the Marina bougieness.

We came for brunch, and I decided on the double patty Americana burger for the extra dollar since the brunch burger trades off the extra patty for bacon a fried egg. My friends got the brunch burger and loved it, though the fried egg is runny and could be messy if you're not eating the burger with a fork and knife (which you most definitely should, since you're in the Marina.) 

The Americana burger is based on classic ingredients, but meticulously perfected each one so well that everything synergized into indulgent deliciousness. There's no fancy eggy brioche bun, blue cheese, grilled onions, or mushrooms; instead, it's your basic toasted sesame bun (though with schmexy grill marks), American cheese, thousand island sauce, lettuce, pickles, and raw onions. However the finely chopped lettuce, thinly sliced pickles, and delicately cut onion rings imparted a unique texture and subtly augmented the flavors of the beef. The focus remained largely on the patty, which was a perfect medium well. It didn't seem too dry, especially with the overlay of melted cheese. My favorite part was the slightly crispy exterior, as if the patty had been briefly pan-fried.

I was disappointed that the Americana burger at brunch comes with salad, since I've heard good things about the crispy onions that accompanies the burger on the dinner menu. The salad was decent though, with fresh mixed greens, a tangy balsamic dressing, and a little relief that makes you feel somewhat healthier when you eat the burger.

At $16 (~$22 after tip, tax, and SF mandate) it's pricey, but for a famous burger that hits so many lists, the decent portion size (I took half of it home for leftovers), and the fact of dining in the Marina, in my opinion it's a worthwhile adventure.

Let me state a disclaimer that I am not a burger person. As a former Berkeley student, I (stereo-typically) went through a clean-eating-obsessed-vegetarian phase and was horrified of burgers. But since living in burger-obsessed SF and dating a burger-obsessed boyfriend, I have gradually converted back though I'm sometimes inclined to order the veggie burger, much to boo's disapproval.

TL;DR: Good burger, approved by someone who generally doesn't like burgers. Just make sure you dress nicely while in the Marina (though leggings are okay if it looks like limited edition Lululemon yoga wear).
author: Edna C.

description:
My friends and I came here after a 9 mile hike so we were starving by the time we got here. My friends wanted to eat some burgers and I remember this place having positive burger reviews so we decided to come here. Parking is definitely a struggle here even in the middle of the afternoon when it's not peak eating hours, so be prepared to circle around for a while to find some street parking that will actually fit your car length. The place wasn't that crowded around 4pm and so we got seated at one of the communal tables (but we still had the table to ourselves). 

I ordered a piece of cornbread as an appetizer and because I really wanted to try the homemade ricotta I basically ordered that as my entree. My friends both opted for the burger and it came with these fried onion things that they really enjoyed. They were both raving about the burger but that could also be because we were so starved from the hike. I didn't really like the cornbread because it was dry and tasted funny. On the other hand, the ricotta was delicious but I definitely had trouble finishing it and made a point to share it with my friends. It comes with a good amount of crackers but you'll definitely want to put a lot of ricotta on the crackers in order to eat up all the ricotta on the plate. Overall, I definitely recommend this place to people who are okay with spending a little more money than usual on food (aka almost everywhere in SF).
author: Catherine S.

description:
I had to review this place having been back twice in the last month... and I'm not even a San Francisco resident! Causwells may have the best burger that I've ever had in a very long time. It doesn't really matter what you order with the side (they offer salad or potatoes)... you have to get it. I would recommend either the Americana or the Brunch Burger depending on what time you arrive.

You know a place is special when you've just stumbled across it while walking down the Marina and your expectations going into it are virtually non-existent! Makes for a way better meal, doesn't it? I would suggest taking an Uber down here because parking is going to be a pain to find no matter when you go. The service was great and the drink menu could keep a man there for days. 

I'm already excited to come back! Definitely would suggest stopping by!
author: Steve N.

description:
I came here for the Americana Burger because I'd heard it was really good. But I wasn't expecting the great service and delicious short ribs. I'm happy to report my experience: 

The hostess sat us within minutes of arriving although we had no reservations. We got a great table by the window and they took our order promptly. 

When I asked about the wine selection, the first server gave me a sample of a Cab and a Merlot. When the next server came back to see which one I liked, I pointed to my glass, unsure of which one it was. He took it, sniffed it, and said, "That's the cab. This one's the Merlot." (That was pretty HOT!) 

We got the burger which was cooked to juicy perfection. It comes with tangy pickles, melted American cheese, and creamy sauce. We added two thick slices of bacon and avocado, of course. The burger is set next to a mound of crispy salty onions that you just can't stop eating. 

Next, I had braised short ribs that were soft and tender. They were on a bed of crunchy, bright yellow cauliflower that reminded me of a spicy Indian dish. So, so GOOD! 

I loved everything and my friend and I can't stop talking about coming back to this place.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
3.5 stars

My bf and I spent about 30 mins looking on SF eater's essential burger list for a great burger to eat last night. We finally agreed on Causwells. My bf said he had tried the place before and it was good. When we got to the restaurant, I realized that I actually HAD been there before but totally forgot what the burger tasted like. We ate here regardless. 

I got the burger again, substituting out the onion shoestrings for french fries. The burger was decent, but nothing super satisfying. I think this underwhelming feeling is why I totally forgot what the burger tasted like the FIRST time I came here, unfortunately. Also, I think I got a bad batch of fries, because they didn't taste too fresh. My bf got the same burger, but onion shoestrings - and those were SOOO good. I kind of wish I just stuck with those to begin with. A side note, they have this organic ketchup here that I'm not a huge fan of. I wish they had Heinz! 

Service was a little slow, they seemed understaffed so I'll give them a pass. They were friendly though!
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Decent burger and service for a casual meal.

We stopped by with a reservation for 3 on a Sunday around mid-day, and they let us upsize the group to 4, which we greatly appreciated. We split a ricotta dish as a group, which was quite tasty, while a friend and I split the burger and the pork hash, both of which were solid but nothing particularly amazing. The service throughout was helpful, and I'd recommend it for a low-key meal for small groups.
author: Dennis J.

description:
Very disappointed. 

Tried ordering to go but no one seemed to care. 

My last visit was also off. Octopus was slimy and gross.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This place has a great vibe with very friendly staff. My food was definitely good. When you're a hash ordering kind of girl, and they put tots in it, it's a no brainer. I was pleased with the market veg hash

My girlfriend both ordered breakfast burgers with hard-friend eggs. Unfortunately they both got runny yolk on their burgers. 
We were seated quickly and enjoyed ourselves!
author: Rachel D.

description: Try the eggs Benedict absolutely delicious good food good service I would recommend located on Chestnut so it's a perfect location great coffee
author: Louise M.

description: 23 dollars (not including the tip)for a burger and fries dammmmmn. No biggie I knew the price would be a little high due to place and the services. The waitress didn't ask me about the burger and the way I like it to be cooked so I ended up eating mid rare bloody burger which is nasty because I don't like to see any redness on my burger but oh well there is s fist time for everything I still enjoyed it. They have this nasty ketchup that just tastes like tomato paste not ketchup so I could eat the fries. Over all I'd rather go to super duper and get a cheaper burger for the same quality in my opinion
author: Adam L.

description: I can see why this place is so highly rated and regarded. The food is incredible and the atmosphere is  great.  Awesome place for either a date or just casual dining.  I always go to dinner here every time I'm in San Francisco and it's never once disappointed.  Thanks for a great meal!  Make sure you try the burger.
author: Louis K.

description: Totally disappointed! The worst corn bread ever, fat ribs and dry pasta I don't even want to talk about the service....
author: Teddy N.

description:
After cycling class with the Bestest, I had a hunger for a fat juicy burger and off we go to Casuwells. 

1) Decent burger, but it's not like out of this world. Plus, how could you not have a side of fries?!?!

2) The place is small and stuffy. Super cramped.

3) Good for ppl watching. 

Overall, I thought the burger was overpriced and the place was too stuffy. Definitely didn't care much for scene or their service at all.
author: Owie N.

description: Menu felt too limited for me. I got the burger and was not at all impressed. Not sure what others are raving about. Especially put off by the american cheese; at least have the option of something else.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Very strong burger! One of the best I've had in the Bay Area and that is saying something since I have been on a burger crawl trying a few different places each week. It was so juicy and full of flavor. Two thin griddled patties smothered with American cheese, covered in a house made sauce and topped with a griddled sesame bun. Yum! 

My wife had the chilaquiles which was just ok. 

Casual place that smells like great coffee. Service was super friendly despite our obnoxious and overtired kid. 

Definitely recommend if you are looking for a strong brunch spot.
author: Tarek S.

description: This place is AMAZING! I had the burger and it was Heavenly... along with the tomatoe soup it had a special kind of kick.   Simply Delicious! Totally recommend this place! Oh yeah... outstanding service too!
author: Carol M.

description: So, I'm writing this review after my 2nd time there. Both times, everything was delicious. We ordered the American burger. It was really tasty & had double meats. It came with the best fried shoestring onion rings. We also ordered the yams. They were very soft & had a nice sweetness to them. This was a to go order & still was hot & tasted great when we finally ate. Will go back again!
author: Robyn M.

description: Stopped by on a Sunday late afternoon.  Were seated immediately.  Tried the ricotta, grilled octopus and a burger.  Ricotta was excellent!  Creamy with a nice honey drizzle, served with crispy pita like chips.  So good!  Octopus was also nice.  Big pieces, with a nice grilled taste and tender.  Served on an arugula and fennel salad.  Very tasty.  Burger was decent.  I would describe it as a gourmet in-and-out burger.  I wasn't crazy about the American cheese and next time, I'll get it with bacon.  The fried onion strings were a nice accompaniment. In all, great location on Chestnut, good service, and good quality food at above average price.  Total for 2, with a beer and soda was $63.
author: Brian K.

description:
Our first meal in San Fran! 

We came for the Americana burger. Originally from Ny we have high expectations for a burgers. Minetta Tavern is basically the 8th wonder of the world. This place has a very solid burger. However, my favorite part of the meal was our buttermilk biscuit! Holy moly. Perfectly crunchy on the outside and super moist and flavorful on the inside. I'd take 4 more of those to go!
author: Kayla P.

description:
Great food, terrible service.

My husband and I have been going to Causwells for years. We think the burgers here are simply the best. We have taken our friends and family members from out of town to this place to proudly show it off.

We had a terrible experience when we tried to have a family reunion at Causwells. They lost our reservation. My husband sent the wrong response to the text confirmation. He realized and called the restaurant immediately. After spending 10 minutes on the phone, he was told that we had a reservation. 

When we passed by the restaurant 2 hours before our reservation, my husband walked into Causwells re-confirm our reservation. The waitress first said that we did not have a reservation. Afterwards, she noticed that our reservation was canceled despite it was confirmed over the phone the night before. They decided to put us (13 people aged from 4 to 82) on 3 separate tables, two of which are bar tables. We made it clear to them that 3 of our group are young children. That did not make any rearrangement..

One of our children slid and bumped her head on the table during dinner. There were two empty tables next to our normal table for most of our meal. I wish the restaurant could have given them to us and told us the time that we had to return the tables. The waitress that served our table who was the same as the one who made our table arrangement seemed to be annoyed at us the entire time. She did not bother to smile at all.

It is very disappointing this has happened. This is the second time in a week that we took our out of town guests to Causwells. We are hesitant to return to this place given our bad experience today.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
We went here for my birthday, because I'd seen it on so many "best burgers in SF" lists, and I wanted to see what the fuss was about. Yeah, the Americana burger lives up to the hype. The fried onion strings were also excellent, and the place is cozy, especially on a rainy night like it was that night. Service was also great.

I got the burger as-is, and that was awesome on its own. But next time -- and there will be a next time -- I'm going for the bacon.
author: Cheshire I.

description: Easy go to after an event at the PoFA. Not the best lamb shank I've had and polenta was okay.
author: Lorraine O.

description: Causewells burger takes the win for my favorite burger in the city. I've been twice now, and each time I was extremely happy with the quality and size of the burger. I went for dinner and brunch and both times I got the American burger but during brunch, I had the Americana burger with bacon and an egg. We also tried the hash but I thought it was a bit bland. The pot de creme is just okay so I don't recommend this for dessert. Causewells is a great spot in the city, and I definitely recommend dropping by for a great burger.
author: Radhika G.

description:
I had the Hush puppies, birthday burger and chicken linguini here. My favourite was the chicken linguini, it's been a while since I've had this dish this way. It wasn't dry at all! 
The atmosphere is great for smaller groups. The location is perfect for after dinner or before drinks. This place is on the casual but still formal. Street parking only.
author: Kelly L.

description: It was such a beautiful day as I was walking down Chestnut St in the beautiful Marina District   I stumbled across Causwells with alfresco dinning I decided to stop and have lunch I was greeted  immediately by the very friendly staff. I needed a place to sit in this beautiful sunny afternoon and do some work emails I ordered the arugula salad and a glass of wine I will add the specifics after I double check the menu again. The staff game me the most amazing service especially Chris. My salad was amazingly delicious and the wine was superb. Thanks for a lovely afternoon after a very hectic work morning! I'll be back soon!
author: Rosemarie D.

description: Want to go for 5-stars, but it's frustrating that they have such a limited menu for my date (celiac gluten free) and dishes that could so easily be vegan... for instance, "ROASTED WINTER VEGETABLES", the crispy chickpea cake could easily be made with almond milk in place of dairy milk... no one would ever know! Won't be coming back until they can augment the menu for the rapidly growing segment of eco-conscious diners.
author: Ryan E.

description: One of the best burgers I've had in a very long time!!!! The burger was juicy with tons of flavor. The avocado was creamy and the bun was just perfectly toasted! The Mexican ale was awesome defiantly a great taste with a smooth finish! If your in the marina and want a great burger this is the place for sure. Parking is very limited so I recommend getting a ride here or you get lucky finding parking! Food and drinks are 5 stars for sure you won't be disappointed!
author: Anthony V.

description:
Give me burger or give me...nothing haha. I had a serious hunger and my craving was a burger. I've read some of the articles and the up and down reviews but decided to come here anyway. 

I ordered a saison and wifey got the IPA, both were right on the money. I don't like it when a saison gets too sour and this one didn't disappoint from Hen House-one of my favs as it so has it.

Then on to the food. My eye is stuck on the prize...the Americana burger with avocado and bacon. This is not just an elevated Big Mac though I could see why some might want to say that. Yes it's cooked how they decide but that's ok in my book as everything comes together in this one. The special sauce and pickles all shine through. Can't go wrong with cheddar ever on a burger either. Comes with shoestring onion rings. Magnifique! My counterpart ordered the brithday special which was out of this world on a totally different level. I don't even know what was all in there but it was all melt in your mouth good. Definite presence of truffle. We didn't even bother with her side salad that came with it. 

Then for dessert we ordered the donut bread pudding. This was the only thing that was a bit of a let down. I was really looking forward to it but I didn't get any type of wow factor from it. That's ok the main event was the burger and I was definitely satisfied with that.

Service - we had a wonderful experience. She was full of joy and when asked for advice was on the money. 

Overall - loved it. We'll be back. A bit pricey but come on every where in the city is the same in this arena. $15-20.
author: Guisela L.

description: Came for lunch and had the Beet with Kale salad plus chicken.  It was delicious, very fresh and healthy.  Love how quaint the restaurant is!
author: Lisa M.

description: Great brunch! The pulled pork hash was really flavorful and filling, good touch of tots. The others had their brunch burger which I had a bite of and loved. Solid brunch but nothing spectacular, which is why this wasn't a 5 Star. We went at 2pm Presidents' Day and it was packed, but we only waited 20 mins for 3 people.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Four of us stopped here for a quick meal after walking to the Palace of Fine Arts from my hotel in the Financial District. We had consulted yelp for "clean eating."  So glad we did.  What a find!

They have lovely outside seating, and we were seated immediately.  Son and daughter's gf ordered the pulled pork hash.  They both liked it; however, the portion was a bit on the smallish size.   Daughter and I ordered the brunch burger and veggie hash, sharing both.   Oh my!  The brunch burger was absolutely perfect--quality beef, thick and crispy bacon.  The only problem was that when my daughter cut the burger in half, the egg yellow squirted out.  Fortunately, it landed on the table rather than on her!  The greens that we got with the burger were excellent. We shared some of them with still-hungry son since we received a generous amount.  I also shared some of the bacon from my half of the burger with him.  The veggie hash was very tasty, full of flavorful veggies and topped with a flawless poached egg. 

We were in a bit of a hurry since son had to fly back to NM that afternoon; therefore, we didn't have time to read all reviews in advance.  If we had,  I'm fairly sure everyone except son would have ordered burgers. (Son doesn't eat beef.)  In my opinion, the hashes are overpriced for the portion size, and the burger is SO good. 

Service was excellent.  We drank water, and the carafe was refilled several times.
author: Ruth C.

description:
BEST BURGER IS SAN FRANCISCO. Hands down. And I've had at least 50+ in my time here. This burger is a beautiful diner style burger that comes with delicious fried onions. Two fresh patties, American cheese, great sauce, super juicy, fluffy sesame bun, crunchy pickles and onions. Fabulous. 

For some reason. I find that it's better after 3pm. They won't give you fried onions until after 3, and the burger gets better, too. 

Nice outdoor seating with heat lamps makes it dog-friendly even when it's cool out. Serious bonus points.
author: Celie H.

description: Don't even look at the menu when you arrive here. Receive your greetings from the host, sit down in your chair, and when they begin to extend their hand to deliver your menu.. you look them dead in the eye and in a stern, but somewhat appreciative voice, you tell them you want to order the burger. Without hesitation, you tell them you want to add bacon to it as well. They will slowly begin to understand the routine, but you once again beat them to the punch and tell them you would like the burger cooked medium as well. Now they will be taken aback, but hold your ground. You are the captain now and they are Tom Hanks. They will nod in agreement and moments later they will gift you one of the best treasures in SF. Enjoy your juicy and meaty burger with confidence now, Captain.
author: Jay R.

description: Best burger in town, love the vibe and the people that work here, try the burger with avocado, thank me later
author: P E.

description: My wife and I came here for lunch. I ordered the burger, and my wife had the chicken sandwich. The food was delicious, reasonably priced for San Francisco, and a cool atmosphere. I would definitely recommend.
author: Jasson C.

description: One of the best cheeseburgers I have had in a long time.  Grilled so they get that carmelized crunch on the outside.  Served with thinly sliced pickles, lettuce and Causwell's "sauce"......get a side of crispy onions.  Thin, barely battered and sweet.  Killer.
author: michelle k.

description:
I've been to Causwells a number of times and have been generally satisfied.  But his time the absence of service or common sense was a disgrace.  On entering the restaurant at the time of my OpenTable reservation, the hostess told me she was not ready to seat me.  I would have to wait.  After 10 minutes of standing about I approached the hostess and asked what the problem was, as the place was half empty.  She told me that she wanted to seat me at a corner table that was still occupied; when I asked why she couldn't seat me at any of the open tables she agreed.  This was ridiculous. 

After being seated I waited.  And waited and waited.  Nothing.  After more than 10 minutes I was about to leave when a waitress, seeing me place my hat on my head approached.  I told her that it didn't seem that I was to be served.  She said she would do so, without apology.  Is that service?  

As to the food, it was pretty good.  A wild arugula salad was nicely portioned and the asian pear lent a nice counterpoint to the arugula.  

Next, I asked if I could get the burger with carrots substituted for the crispy onions.   The waitress checked with the kitchen and said they could do that for a bit of a surcharge (five dollars).  Fine.  But when the plate arrived the serving of carrots was paltry.  For seven dollars I could have had an actual side of carrots and the onions as well. 

They really needed a manager on the floor during my visit this past Saturday night.
author: David D.

description:
Amazing! 10/10.

Here's what you need to know: order the house-made ricotta, and - of course - the burger, BUT make sure to save plenty of room for the donut bread pudding for dessert!

We came on National Cheeseburger Day, which was perfect for this place. I tried several appetizers (the deviled eggs, the hush puppies, and the aforementioned ricotta); the deviled eggs and hush puppies were good, but the ricotta outshined them by far. And it's a generous portion, to boot!

For entrees, I didn't even look at the other options, because I wanted to try their famous burger. It was great! The choice of American cheese is odd, though (and they don't have cheddar or anything that you can swap it for), because it's such a cheap-tasting cheese, but they obviously put so much care into the meat. I added bacon and avocado, because, well, bacon and avocado (does that really need an explanation?). Overall, it was a very tasty and well-put-together burger - I was surprised how well it stayed together despite being heaped with so much tasty stuff. And I loved the massive tangle of onion strings that came on the side. 

Now, dessert. I'm glad we decided to be gluttonous and each get our own orders of the donut bread pudding, because I would NOT have been nice trying to share this. Best. Bread. Pudding. Ever. It's served in a shallow bowl of spiced milk, which was the perfect counterpoint. I could eat this forever and die happy (of diabetes, no doubt, but whatever).

Man, that was a good dinner.
author: Liz F.

description: Awesome trout and amazing burger! The kinda melt in your mouth burger that has full but not overwhelmingly flavors. Try it for yourself and you'll be back for more! It is a cute little place in Marina with a relaxed ambiance. Very casual and hip.
author: Alex G.

description:
I consider Causwells' Americana Burger to be the best I've had in the Bay Area. 

So the deal is I'm on an endless search for a proxy to the best burger in America, the single at Chicago's Au Cheval (if you disagree with that designation, I'm afraid we can't be friends). My experience with all things burger in South Bay has been wickedly disappointing, and through thorough Internet searching, I had Causwell's earmarked. Thanksfully, I was not disappointed.

Our weekend brunch there was ad hoc. We were doing some casual sightseeing with the kids, got hungrier, and realized we were a stone's throw away. Though the dining room was booked, we snagged an outdoor table right away with our two little ones, which turned out to be fairly successful. It's a nice Parisian-style setup, with cramped tables and a scenic view of a major Marina drag.

So the Causwells burger. It's a riff on the no-frills fast food burger, but with faux frills and a price tag to match. It's okay, I can dig it. That's Au Cheval in a nutshell. The perfect burger? It's got American cheese. It's got a thin patty. With flavor, so you can eat just the patty with nothing else and still be satisfied. It's got a tasty sauce, though. In case you need it. And the bread is good, neither overwhelming nor detracting. And that's it. Other ingredients are optional and should value-add.

Causwell's meets all standards. No, it's not quite as good as Au Cheval. The meat is seasoned well but not perfectly like Au Cheval's griddled goodness. The thousand island "In N Out spread" replica isn't as good as the Au Cheval's perfect dijonnaise. And the $16 price tag, woof. It makes Au Cheval's single look like a small bite at $11.

But enough negativity. Causwell's does a great burger. Just writing about it, I want it again. Until Yelp finds me one better, it's the Bay Area gold standard.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
When I pick a sit down place for breakfast, I expect to get better than I can get at home. 

They said they opened at 9 but we were the first people in on a Sunday morning at 9:15. We were sat with the sun in my husband's eyes. I would have thought they had the "good" tables figured out but our fault too for not asking to sit somewhere else.

Aside from that and the fact we were never offered a refill on our coffee, everything was fine. Nothing that would knock it out of the park. We ordered a biscuit, which was fine. And chilaquiles that would have benefited from some nice zipping up by a homemade salsa and a few more nicely seasoned black beans.

The guys sitting next to us, in a completely empty restaurant they choose to seat two sets of guests right next to each other... said their vegetable hash was good. 

Final thoughts: fine if you are in the neighborhood but not worth getting in your car for breakfast.
author: MaryFran L.

description: Stopped in here after a friend recommended their burger. I was not disappointed! So juicy, so delicious. The onion strings and a cider were a perfect pairing. Sat at the bar, the service was quick and the staff was very polite.
author: Sarah T.

description: This was, hands down, the best burger I have ever had in my life. The meat was incredible and the sauce was amazing. Everything about it was so good. I got it with fries instead of onion rings on the side. Friendly and attentive staff. I will definitely be going here again. And again. And again.
author: Molly J.

description:
Had heard a lot about their burgers and got a chance to try it out last Thanksgiving break with my family. The burgers were really good, so much flavor and the meat tasted good. I was a little surprised when the server mentioned that they do not serve rare patties. They do have some good beer options to pair with the burgers. Enjoyed my meal here so won't mind visiting again.

PS: It's good for smaller groups of 6-8. We were about 14 people and had to be seated at 3 different tables even though we got in when the restaurant opened. So be a little mindful of that.
author: Varun V.

description: For 37 years, I've been on a quest for the perfect burger-- the search is over! Double patty, equal distribution of cheese, sesame bun, secret sauce, thinly sliced onion and pickle= heaven on your tongue. If you're even sort of curious, run, don't walk to Causwells!
author: Nadia H.

description:
TL;DR: Delicious burgers, ricotta cheese, deviled eggs, beverages; excellent service
-------
Went here after our annual family tradition of attending the City Ballet's Nutcracker, after looking for walkable places near the Palace of Fine Arts.
I'm not usually a beef-eater, but I do make an exception for awesome burgers. I was hopeful and wasn't disappointed.
We got the deviled eggs, ricotta cheese, chopped salad to share. 3 Americana burgers (sans cheese for me). I loved the wine and hubby loved the bloody marys.
Service was exemplary..usually in many SF restaurants they're not very nice to families with kids, but not so here. Every server was not just nice to the adults, but they were super, super nice to our son, and other kids who were performers at the Nutcracker. 
One star off because we thought the burgers were more salty than they should have been, but we'll definitely go again...
author: Shilpi D.

description: I just want to compliment the chef here again. Picked up a to-go order on short notice, 15 minutes later and bam this food is amazing, I wish this chef could be in multiple places at once so all could enjoy the great cooking -- well done
author: Aaron W.

description: I'm chalking my burger experience up to an off night as it's obvious how popular it is!  To me, the burger was good, but it really doesn't stand out.  Mine was well done and my partner's was medium which is a bad sign in regards to consistency.  I was also looking forward to the special sauce, but it lacked flavor.  It was definitely good (I ate every bite), but I don't think I'd come back again for it.  The space is also quite awkward.  There are very narrow areas between tables resulting in staff (and everyone, really) trying to avoid bumping into one another.  I might come back for a cider and some deviled eggs if I was in the neighborhood though!
author: Janelle F.

description: Good service and good quality of food; however, the menu is extremely limited. Not many choices to pick here.
author: Babak G.

description: I don't mind this place at all. I like that it's hectic, fast paced, noisy, small and intimate. The kind of place that makes you feel slightly stimulated and alive. This is likely not a 'creative' foodie joint, as their menu is standard Californian brunch fare- 1)no surprise Eggs and Potats reportedly a pass 2) necessary Chilaquiles 3) a croque monsieur, and lastly the one I like and the only food item I tried here anyway, the brunch burger. Good sparkling wines and rosés. I do like the novelty of the space and it's semi elegant casual approach, would recommend
author: Juls C.

description: The burger was excellent! It is a huge cheese burger. You can add bacon and avocado as well. The meat is definitely fresh. You can tell by the taste. It as juicy, but not greasy. It is a double patty. I like the simplicity of it. The fixings were standard and nothing fancy. The bun was fresh. It did not become soggy by the burger as some hamburgers do. It just overall had a good flavor. The downside was there were no fries to order:(.. when you have an awesome burger you want some hot and crispy steak fries! That would have completed my completely fatty meal... lol... but so good. Instead they give you some onion strings. Those were okay but not fries... We also sat outside. They have heating lamp so even if you were cold you could stay warm outside.
author: Angela M.

description:
This place has gotten a lot of good press for their Cheeseburger.  I had one today and all the hype is well justified.  It was delicious, 5 points out of five.  It's a two-patty affair, with American cheese, tiny onions, pickles and a green salad.  No fries, but they would distract us from the Main Event.  The patties were cooked just right and were very juicy.  Sesame-top bun.  What makes this a perfect cheeseburger is that the chef is not afraid to put a little seasoning on his perfect ground beef.  Just enough to elevate this sandwich to the Burger Parthenon.  Lots of other good stuff on the menu [grilled salmon on a bun], lots of good wine and beer.  

Get in here!
author: Lee P.

description: Dropped in here after a show at the palace of fine arts for a drink. Loved it! Good selection of beer, the food smelled and looked good (we didn't get food) and the aesthetic was comfortable and warm. I enjoyed the stout made with Four Barrel coffee (local) and it was very smooth! The Hefe was good too as always. The service was quick and cordial. The location was in a safe, clean spot in the Marina district. I enjoyed my experience
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Oh God, this is my all time favorite indulgent* burger in the city (second favorite to a burger is San Luis Obispo... I know) beating out Umami, Roam, and Super Duper Burger.

*The topic of best burgers is always tricky because you have different burgers for different tastes. Example: Inn n Out will always be the best burger period, but sometimes you need something that feels luxurious, indulgent, Causewell-y...

That said, the Causewell burger is the kind of food porn you think about late at night. It's the kind of burger that captivates its pursuers for sheer admiration as the waiter is placing it on the table.

I've tried some of their other things but wasn't blown away, thus four stars.
author: Steph L.

description:
I didn't post this right away because I didn't want to focus on such a crappy experience. We came here on 2/25/2018. About 2:30ish, so not very busy at all.  We never thought we would be treated as terribly as we did but it happened. 
I truly support all sorts of small businesses throughout the Bay Area. My friend who came with me, owns three restaurants in San Francisco so we often go out to support various restaurants. 
We ordered waters, sodas, burgers, and the bread pudding. Burgers are good, nothing I would crave for, beautiful presentation though . Crispy onions are a little salty, possibly because we hardly consume much salt. What reeled is in was 'All star donut' pudding. Took it to go, it was okay as well. Pretty simple, right?! I ordered the brunch burger so the yolk will explode and obliterate the one cloth napkin you have and if you try to ask for another napkin depending on your waitress and if you are a person of color, you will get ignored. Caucasian female with straight shoulder length hair, will ignore you if you ask her anything, but she will make sure to come back to bring your credit cards back.  This is the only time she would acknowledge us. After ignoring us, I was so pissed, I got up to grab another napkin off another table and looked for a utensil. The hostess realized I needed something. I told her I'll just help myself since the waitress refused to acknowledge us. The 'supervisor, Gaby, sure ran over to help us as I went to sit down. It was weird to be asked our names and to make sure we came back. She asked if we were done as soon as she was done asking her questions so probably a ploy to make sure we left since the patrons next to us were less than a foot away. She 'made it right' by  taking off our sodas and the pudding off the tab. Big whoop. Our original waitress was the only decent one but forgot our waters. Mind you, I wouldn't bring the race thing up but as I'm watching two Asian gals a few tables in front of me not get waited on, until their Caucasian friend who shows up some time later sits down is when this same waitress decides to take their order. You can at least ask if they want anything to drink. 
We don't care how much we spent. Service counts for a huge chunk. I remember AMAZING service at an IHOP! I guess I shouldn't have expected that much. Trust us, when we REALLY gave her the benefit of a doubt, we asked her twice said excuse me three times each and she was taking orders less than a foot away. I don't ask for much but trust and believe patrons are more than appreciative if we just get the 'basics'. A couple of 'how are things', fill water (never got this) , just maybe some attentiveness would be nice like grabbing a napkin when yolk is running down their arm. 

Good luck there is always room for improvement!
author: Vanessa T.

description:
Brunch in the Marina on a sunny day means: 

Suns out, guns out
Lulu girls with the nice bums
Wear your sunglasses
And stare at them tight a...

Ahem. This is turning into a dirty rap song.

To cut the dirtiness from your day, order the healthy granola. It's a nice sized bowl of yummy Strauss yogurt, fruit and their housemade granola. Is it really worth the $9? I could've added an extra $5 and gotten the burger instead, but after a week full of happy hours, the last thing I needed was a gut busting burger with the best in SF reputation. (stay tuned..) 

I was able to steal a couple of forkfuls of his Chilaquiles which was an awesome flavor combination of tortilla chips, black beans, scrambled egg, salsa verde and queso fresco. I wish there was more filling than chips though. 

Service is great and she constantly checked on us considering how packed it was! This is a narrow restaurant and the awkward seating by the window felt a little big snug so if you prefer more space, ask to be seated outside on the sidewalk. Plus, this gives you the best angle for people watching.
author: Janice C.

description:
Came here today with a friend and had a great experience. 

They have a row of tables set up outside, so we were able to sit outside with our pups (always extra nice when a spot is pup friendly). We were a little nervous about the foggy weather being too cold to sit outside, BUT we were fine due to the amazing heat lamps they have set up! 

Food: 5/5
We both chose burgers-my friend got the Americana and I got the Brunch. Both were bomb.com!
If you've had a shake shack burger-these kind of reminded me of them. The meat had that same crispy edge like Shake Shack burgers do. The Brunch burger comes with a fried egg on it and it was cooked perfectly! Just runny enough to get the bread a little wet. Nom!! 
The Americana didn't have an egg, but had essentially the same stuff. The main difference was that the Americana had 2 patties.
Both burgers came with a side salad that was dressed perfectly!

Service: 5/5 
We had great service-our waitress was attentive and checked on us throughout the meal. Another waiter even brought our dogs water! 

Price: 4/5
Prices were fair. A bit on the pricey side-I believe our bill was $35 for the two burgers. Kind of expected though for a marina joint. They had other great options on the menu that we were too full to try, so I will definitely be back even though they are on the pricier side. 

It's a great brunch place to try! And by the looks of it, a great dinner spot as well! I'll update my review when I get a chance to try their dinner.
author: Milena R.

description:
This was such a fun spot and damn it was delicious. Our waiter was knowledgeable and hilarious. I could eat here all the time, and that's basically my plan whenever I go back to SF. 

The crispy pork belly was outstanding. The beet salad was very different than what we're seeing everywhere and was surprising and unexpected and really, really yummy. Then we had to share a burger--and it was just as delicious as I'd hoped. 

Great wine list too. Loved loved this place.
author: Meredith B.

description:
Visited from
ny and a friend brought me here for what he described as the best burger around . Well my friend was Right this place had the BEST burger I ever had . The burger has it all the flavor ,the bacon and a perfect bun to compliment the burger . This spot is worth a 6 hr plane ride from ny because it is that GOOD
author: Greg L.

description: On a nice walk on a busy street we find a cool hole in the wall type of place next to an old Theater. It has some tables outside although they are all occupied. No problem seating at the window is much better giving us the perfect vantage point of the endless parade of couple families and dog lovers. I had the pork hash that was excellent and the Chilaquiles in salsa Verde were very good as well. Service was Great. Next time I return I am going to try the breakfast burger as is looked amazing. Portion sizes are perfect. The only thing I could ask for is that they explain options for ad on to the food, Just an example the chilaquiles were great and another table had added avocado and my wife said the avocado would have made the dish perfect. No problem we now know next time we will order like regulars.
author: Manny G.

description:
I heard about this place from one of those Thrillist online food contests that compares cheeseburgers all across the nation. And it was the runner up. My favorite high end cheeseburger place is Au Cheval in Chicago so I was super curious to find out how this place compared. Especially since it beat Au Cheval!

Well, I tried it and while the burger is good, Au Cheval is still king in my book. But let me give you concrete reasons so you don't think I'm biased by my Chicago roots. Comparisons aside, the burger here is good but I just would not come back and pay for it unless I came back with a curious group of friends. Similar to Au Cheval, the cheeseburger has two thinner patties. However, it doesn't have that amazing thick cut bacon. Or the runny egg. I think you can add bacon to the cheeseburger if you want to, but it's just not the same. The burger here comes with lettuce, pickles, and some thousand island tasting dressing which is pretty good - runs you about $16. 

However, I want to reiterate this is a good cheeseburger! Just not enough to keep someone coming back who is meh about most cheeseburgers. Also the burger comes with a side salad so you feel less bad about gorging yourself. One note: we came during a weekend morning and there wasn't a really long wait but we sat at the bar. I'd think there would be more of a wait during this time if you have a bigger party. The server was incredibly nice. I got a mimosa and she was very generous with the champagne! 

I will also say, if you do come here, please try the deviled eggs. Those are definitely worth going back for.
author: Lin Z.

description: Loved this cute brunch spot. We only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table, and we got a great spot in the restaurant! I definitely wish the entrees were a bit bigger, and the bloody mary's werent very strong, but still good food and good vibes.
author: Sabra M.

description:
Had a reservation for 11AM on a Sunday and was seated immediately. That being said, it took 30 minutes for a server to even come over to get our drink orders. Once we did order drinks it took another 20-30 minutes to get to our table. 

My boyfriend and I both had the burger. It was really delicious and cooked perfectly. My only disappointed was the lack of an option for fries with the burger. Instead I had some breakfast potatoes that I would have preferred to have been at least slightly crispy. 

Outside of that the waiter was very friendly and helpful in beer recommendations, but the service we received up until the food came kind of marred the whole experience.
author: Hannah Y.

description:
Causwells had the best burger I've had in YEARS. It was so good that I'm giving them five stars even though they brought me the wrong side and forgot my request for no pickles. DELICIOUS. GET THE BURGER. 

Our waiter was charming and funny and made sure we were well taken care of, correcting my little order snafus with grace. Causwells was great!
author: Caity C.

description:
Good brunch. Some dishes were better than others. They take reservations, which is useful. 

COST
$25 total per person, fairly reasonable.

* Belgian Waffle - 2 stars
Recommended by the server for having seasonal peaches on top. However, the waffles were incredibly dry, and the thin peach slices were not quite ripe yet. Still a tad sour.

* Americana Burger - 4 stars
Good! I liked the texture to the patty. Everything came together nicely. We weren't asked how the patties should be cooked, we got it medium. That's fine but I would've preferred medium-rare. I also shared this with a friend who's lactose-intolerant, so they actually cooked one of the two patties separately with the cheese, which was a good idea.

* Egg Platter - 3.5 stars
I got to try a bite of the potatoes. They were like mashed potatoes, with bits of crisp and skin. The bacon was nice and crispy too.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
If you're moodin' for a gourmet burger, look no further than Causwells. This place delivers one of the finest, juiciest, perfectly cooked burgers of all time.

Okay, food snobs, you may start to say, but but but but .... "this other place here" and "this other place there," but you're all but missing the point. Gordon Ramsey said it best: "The perfect burger isn't stuffed with so much stuff that you cannot eat it with one hand. It needs to be simple, not take over the meat, and just classic."

Causwells nails the burger with flying colors. Not just for its simplistic presentation, but for its simplistic flavor. Nothing is overpowering the meat, the cheese is melted just right, and the bun is just delicious.

Of course, because I only got the burger, this review means it is solely based on 'the burger.' I'll likely come back for the burger and something else, and if that something else is as impressive as their burgers come, they might end up making my list of favorite burger (and more) joints in the city.
author: Anthony N.

description:
It was President's Day in San Francisco, and just as you would not expect, nothing was open. We walked to Ella's in Presidio Heights and arrived at 2:45 (they close at 3), only to find them closed.  D'oh!  I was so hungry, I was starting to become angry (hangry).  We hastily checked the Yelp app for open restaurants serving breakfast, brunch, or-well-anything!  We dialed up Causwells, and they informed us that not only were they still serving brunch, but that they had a special holiday brunch menu.  Yay!  They even placed our name on the waitlist, despite the fact that we were not there. Yay x 2! 

We began to make our way to Causwells (about 20 minutes away).  And after the hike up, up, up a steep hill to the Marina, I was all out furious.  No fuel, no food, no bueno.  

When we arrived, Causwells was semi-packed. It was a beautiful day, so folks were seated outside as well as in.  I was surprised to find that there were a lot of children there, but it's a holiday and the Marina, so I guess it makes sense.  

We were sat immediately.  I ordered the Shacksbury cider (or whatever the hell it's called) and the boyfriend ordered a Crabbie's ginger beer on ice, which is always a good choice, especially on an unseasonably hot day in San Francisco.  We decided to start with the deviled eggs with smoked trout and the cauliflower soup with brown butter.  I love that cauliflower is in season right now, because every place seems to be serving cauliflower soup, but with the addition of brown butter, you know I had to have that! The deviled eggs were outstanding - I was a little skeptical of the smoked trout addition, but it totally worked, and gave the dish a little something egg-stra.  (Ugh) 

For entrees, I ordered the lunch cheeseburger with no bun.  FYI, I'm not eating carbs right now (I prefer to drink my carbs via alcohol).  It was still super yummy, juicy and cheesy.  My boyfriend got the pork hash, which I also thought was delicious.  With my entrée, I tried a blood orange gose beer they hard on the canned/bottled beers menu, which was simply wonderful.  I want to go back just for that beer!  Keep in mind that Causwells serves beer and wine only, so if you are in need of harder, you'll have to look elsewhere.  

Overall, Causwells was a huge win for us on the holiday weekend.  It's a really cute place in the Marina that is definitely worth a visit or two or three.  The prices are standard, the service is great (despite my pain in the ass boyfriend requesting to move tables), and the crowd is chill.  Seems like it gets crowded, so get there early in the a.m. or later in the p.m.  Delicious!
author: Sunny S.

description:
Charcuterie is complete garbage. No cheese. Very small and poor variety of meats.
Brussel sprouts are alright.
A side of very ordinary fries is $6.

Their burger is $16, and it might the only good thing on the menu. Save your money for in and out.
author: Mark S.

description: Great brunch place. Yummy Bloody Marys. Bomb burgers. Not only was the burger delicious, but their potatoes were unexpectedly good. Add avocado, always. Let's just say I ate everything in this photo in one sitting.
author: Kim L.

description:
Only two things will bring me to the Marina:

(1) The Mr. Marina Competition: http://bit.ly/1mVywMc.
(2) A good burger. 

The Mr. Marina Competition kinda reminds me of the Save By The Bell episode where Bayside holds a date auction to raise money sans Slater's mullet. 

Them dimples though!

Ok, back to that burger...

So Causwells supposedly has a spectacular burger. It's so spectacular that it has been featured on Eater, Thrillist, SFist AND 7x7 as being one of THE very best in SF (and in America). Needless to say, my expectations were high. When I took my first bite, I thought the burger angels were going to play on their harps and unicorns were going to dance in my mouth. Alas, Causwells' Americana Burger ($15.99 + $1.50 bacon) is just a fancy In-N-Out Double Double or Big Mac, on par with Super Duper: http://bit.ly/1N5XwF6. There's absolutely nothing wrong with that but why go all the way to The Marina when you can just go into any one of the six Super Duper locations in SF? 

Instead of one thick patty, the Americana Burger has two thin ones and they only cook the burger medium well: http://bit.ly/1Zj9Fxo which is a cardinal sin IMO. Team medium rare!

The burger was juicy (high fat ratio?) but excessively salty, greasy, and heavy. I love animal spread but the Causwells sauce (thousand island dressing based) made it unnecessarily heavier. No one eats a burger for health but only one of my friends (out of 5) could finish their burger and only because he didn't eat the entire day. Leftovers went uneaten. Don't get me wrong, the burger wasn't terrible -  just terribly overrated and overhyped. 

But...

Those accompanying onion shoestrings were like crack especially with Sir Kensington's ketchup. I would have gladly face shoveled an entire tray and forgo the burger.

My pick for best burger in SF is Rove Kitchen, where the chef uses a chuck, ribeye, and shortrib blend for his thick patty that is cooked to a perfect medium rare and served between house-baked buns: bit.ly/1Bnfq1K. 

We also shared the following small plates:
+ Baby Kale Salad w/ baby yam, bacon, cured yolk, mustard ($13): http://bit.ly/1J1DzUZ.
My favorite dish of the night next to the onion shoestrings. The salad was perfectly dressed and I really enjoyed the sweet yams and salty bacon bits. Didn't taste or see any yolk though. 

+/- Crispy Pork Belly w/ apple, fennel, baby yam, horseradish crème ($15): http://bit.ly/1OgSB8q
You can never go wrong with pork belly - pork flavored butter with a crunchy chicharron-like skin but at $5 a cube, this was overpriced. You can get a big mound of lechon kawali for less than this. 

- Deviled Eggs w/ smoked trout, paprika, mustard ($6.25): http://bit.ly/1PVjHlM
Mediocre compared to Marlowe/Park Tavern, Wayfare Tavern, and Hog & Rocks' deviled eggs.

- Creole Shrimp w/ crispy cornmeal, scallion ($16): http://bit.ly/1W57bma
Ehhh, tasted more like an Indian dish than a Creole one. The small shrimp (5 pieces) were overcooked and rubbery, and at more than $3 a pop, it was another overpriced dish.

- Shacksbury Classic Cider, ABV 6% (Draft - $9): http://bit.ly/1nmsog7
Tasted watered down.

Without a doubt, the service surpassed the food. 5 star service from the welcoming hostess, amiable and attentive server and busboy - our plates were quickly cleared and water glasses were always refilled. Kudos to them because they rocked!

The space is small and lively with seating for about 22-24 in their narrow dining area, 2 communal tables, and bar seating. There's also outdoor seating with heated lamps (yay for dog-friendly seating!). Not recommended for large groups over 6. The bathroom is located next to a two-top so it was awkward having to hover over a couple's table while waiting the restroom to become vacant. I'm sure it's far more awkward for them so do request a table away from the restroom. 

Maybe my friends and I visited Causwells on an off night but we thought that collectively the food was exceptionally mediocre and overrated. I felt bad for even suggesting this place for dinner because my friends came all the way from the Peninsula and South Bay. We should of went to nearby Spaghetti Bros instead. At least we could have bro'd out with the Mr. Marina contestants there... 

My vote goes to Mark, the aerospace engineer holding the adorable golden retriever puppy: http://bit.ly/1lvGRnY! Take my paycheck!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Intimate restaurant with excellent food. 

I came here with my husband and family to celebrate his birthday.  Most of us ordered the burger while his parents ordered the salad.  Bottom line, the burger was fantastic.  We all tried a few sides and appetizers, but the burger is what really stood out.  

I liked the very intimate atmosphere of this restaurant.  The wait staff was very friendly and our food came out promptly.  The only thing I did not like is that when the place fills up there tends to be a line for the bathroom, and since Causwells is a small intimate place, that line tends to back up to the dining tables.  

Overall this was a great dining experience.  I will be back the next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Pier H.

description:
What a great little neighborhood find! We were out on the day that most places were oddly closed, January 2 (New Years Day Observed?) and were thankful to find this place on Yelp (plus it was open!). 

We sat at the beautiful bar and had a few drinks. Sadly it was one of those days were we had been eating bites all day so we weren't hungry but I can't wait to return for that burger. Also, I noticed they are on UberEATS so if I'm not up for the five minute walk from my house I'll be sure to go that route! 

Bartender, Austin was so friendly and turns out almost our neighbor! He was thoughtful with his wine selections and told us all about the owners and their other great locations.
