Hopefully we'll get more awesome service from him when we return!
author: Alison C.

description: I would eat the ricotta and honey with a spoon for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Also one of the best burgers I have ever had. Perfectly cooked. Perfectly melted cheese. Juicy, but not messy.
author: Catrina C.

description: Great service Alex and solid food. Good place to sit street-side bc it's on the sunny side of the street and at the end of Chestnut so the sidewalk isn't too crazy busy.
author: Andrew M.

description: Came here while on a quick trip to San Francisco on a Sunday morning for brunch around 11:30ish. We expected a wait, but were actually able to sit right away on the patio. That may have been the mistake.  I shouldn't really even call it a patio, it's just a few tables side by side out front lined up oddly along the sidewalk. My husband was facing the sun the whole time because I would have been fried, there was just no shade. On to the food. I ordered the pork hash and a coffee and my husband ordered the breakfast burger. We also ordered the smoked trout deviled eggs. The lady who brought my hash actually put a veggie hash in front of me that was meant for the table next to us (on top of us really). Which reminds me that I hated how close the tables were. Anyway, The veggie has looked good- but it wasn't mine. The lady seemed perturbed that I didn't know it wasn't mine. I also ordered a hash so it was confusing. When our order actually came, My hash was just okay. The presentation was nice, but I wished the chunks of pork were smaller. And there was a crazy amount of tots in comparison to the one tiny poached egg served atop. The breakfast burger was delicious, earning them the four stars for me. The deviled eggs lacked flavor and were frankly sour overall. My coffee was never refilled, and the service is very strange. The person who took our order was never seen again, and the people who brought our food, bill and change- all different, and took FOREVER. Now coming home and looking on yelp, it seems as though they may cater to the inside of the restaurant. Obviously in hindsight, I wish we had sat inside. My husband was miserable staring into the sun. We thought people watching would be nice, but it just wasn't worth it with no umbrellas and the closeness of your neighbors. You essentially become a part of their conversation, and that's just weird. Overall, I would suggest the breakfast burger- really tasty, very messy. Terrible service outside, which ruined it for us. It really took a chunk out of our limited time we already had. We won't be going back when in San Francisco.
author: Ryann H.

description:
I have good memories living in the Marina... well except the '89 Loma Prieta earthquake -
and that includes Bechelli's which is the space that Causwell's now occupies. There's a good vibe about this neighborhood place- the understated decor, staff and service, ambiance and food! I had chicken linguine which was very good with nice citrus. It's also a bonus that they offer corkage. It is a limited menu and small place but that describes great neighborhood dining perfectly!
author: Stiv L.

description:
If the recent election is proof that bad times are headed our way look no further than Causwells for your bad time meal.  Mine certainly was.  

Ever since penning my original review of Causwells I've watched other reviews from yelp friends flow in, often with a lower star rating than that I assigned.  I returned with the hope that my assessment would stand but things quickly turned south.  For starters, my 4-person party again got the table nearest the restroom.  Causwells is small, but there's no excuse for the way that restroom door opens directly into the dining area.  If you insist on dining here you should also insist on a spot nearest the windows thus furthest from the restroom.  

Still, on my earlier visit, I sat in the same seat and was able to say "4 stars" but then is not now.  

A House Made Ricotta starter ($11), drizzled with honey, was pedestrian and looked like something assembled following a visit to Trader Joe's.  Shishito Peppers ($7) warranted a shrug; neither good nor bad and the same could be said for a side of Brussels Sprouts ($7.25).  I thought the only starter worth tasting was the Hushpuppies ($7.25).  If I'd sat in the front, with an order of Hushpuppies and a bottle of wine I'd have deemed the evening a success.  

Causwells is known for its American Burger ($15.99) which I'd enjoyed on my previous visit but this time the burger was delivered without catsup or mustard.  Our party of 4 asked for these condiments repeatedly but a good 4 minutes passed, and much eye-rolling from my 3 tablemates, before catsup arrived and it was quite a bit longer and further requests before Dijon mustard appeared at the table.  Our burgers were lukewarm by this time.  No apologies, no explanation.  

Service again became an issue as we finished a Chocolate Pot de Creme ($8) and a Donut Bread Pudding ($8.25).  Plates were scooped off the table by our server without asking and then returned with an "Oh, you're not done with it yet?"  

My meal at Causwells felt like a fitting cap to a thoroughly depressing week.  Poor service, poor ambiance and mediocre food.  Not only did the country just buy a load of crap but so did I.
author: Tracey A.

description:
My boyfriend and I went on New Year's Eve morning for some warm-up mimosas - they were a decent size and a reasonable price ($5.50 a mimosa), which is hard to come by in the city. 

Atmosphere - great vibes, lots of interesting people and loved the inside bar and front patio areas. Good windows if you're sitting inside to still people watch on Chestnut. 

I ordered the Chilaquiles - they make them with the eggs, beans, etc on the bottom and the chips on top which is nice so the chips don't get soggy. 

My boyfriend got the brunch burger and thought it was pretty standard, nothing too special but I enjoyed a bite of it. 

Overall 4 stars instead of 5 because food was good but lacking a little flavor/uniqueness.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
This review is solely for the burger.

After a few weeks of being on a limited diet, I was craving a thick, juicy burger. I don't typically eat a diet heavy in meat, carbs or dairy, but I don't typically restrict myself, either, from my cravings. My partner made us a reservation for 8PM on Thursday evening. "You're craving a burger," he said. "I'll make sure you get a burger." So, Causwells it was. 

To be fair, I hadn't heard of this restaurant before (oops). I don't keep up on the latest in foodie news and I rarely venture to the Marina District. Although our table was ready when we arrived for our reservation, we opted to sit at the bar. The bartender behind the counter was quick to greet us and take our order. I didn't take a good look at the menu, I was there for a reason: the Americana Burger ($15.99). 

The Americana Burger is exactly as you would imagine a classic, American burger to be: American cheese, lettuce, pickles and onions, topped with "Causwells sauce". I added avocado ($1.50). My partner ordered the same, minus avocado and pickles. The flavor combination isn't as adventurous or dynamic as say, what you would find at ROAM, but it packs a decent punch. This burger comes with two beef patties cooked medium, with all its accoutrements packed between a white, sesame bun. Not sure how I would feel about the fried onions it comes with, I ordered a side of french fries ($6) to be safe. Note: this establishment doesn't offer mayonnaise as a condiment, I asked. Ketchup and dijon mustard only!

I suppose the simplicity of this burger is what makes it a 'winner', and in many ways it was. Thick, juicy and flavorful. When my partner took his non-American friend here when he was in town, his friend ordered two and came back the next day for a third, saying it was "the best" burger he had had in his life. I won't go to that extreme. I'll surely come around again, but I won't necessarily drive across town for this burger, either.
author: Kimberlee P.

description: Damn I had only had the burger for delivery before my birthday. Ordered the eggs, good standard. Beets-ahhhhhhmazing. Craving them have to return for these alone. Ribs fall off the bone delicious. And what do I say about the burger that you haven't already heard
author: Jason C.

description: What a GREAT little restaurant. From the moment my friend and I walked in, I could tell it was going to be a great dining experience. The service was excellent and everyone was so friendly. We shared the ricotta spread, which they gave us on the house - definitely would recommend. I had the pappardelle and it was excellent. Can't wait to come back here again.
author: Angelina H.

description:
Appetizers were all standard (heirloom tomato salad, ricotta, and ribs) - they were fresh, had good balance but nothing special

The main thing I wanted to try was their famous burger. In a nutshell, the beef had an amazing crisp exterior yet retained a moist flavorful center. It reminded me of eating an elevated 4x4 from In N Out. The price point is a little steep in comparison but on its own I thought it was pretty rock solid. 

Overall Thoughts

Solid burger, appetizers not so much
author: Eddie W.

description:
The burger here is one of the best in San Francisco, and also made the Thrillist list of top burgers in America. I was a little wary of its accolades, so naturally I had to just try it in person to see for myself. I came here for lunch around 2:30 pm on a Saturday, so there was no wait for a table (score!). I assume that if you came during peak lunch time on a weekend, you'll have to wait for a little bit since the place is not huge. The place is fairly small, so come with 2-4 people, but they do have 2-3 tables that will accommodate 6-8 people if you have a large party.

They have a pretty decent selection for brunch: waffles, omelettes, chilaquiles, biscuits & gravy, salad, and their infamous burgers. For brunch, you can get the Brunch Burger ($15) which comes with a single beef patty, american cheese, fried egg, bacon, aioli, lettuce, pickle and onion. The size of the burger is quite generous, and not bad for $15, considering some places charge you the same price for a burger 2/3 of the size. My boyfriend got this and he really loved it -- so much that I only got a bite or two to try it, and then the rest disappeared before I even noticed.

I got the Americana Burger ($15.99), which was similar to a Shake Shack where there are 2 patties with cheese in the middle, or In-N-Out double double. If you like either of those burgers, then you will like this. The burger patties are crispy on the outside, slightly thinner than most patties, and more well-done than rare. The meat is moist and the cheese makes the whole burger really tasty. They have a Causwell's Sauce which is similar to the In-N-Out sauce (almost like a thousand island), lettuce, pickles, and thinly sliced onions. It's delicious and I ate the entire thing and would have eaten more if it was bigger.

My only complaint was that the brunch burgers came with salad, and not with the crispy onion rings that I was drooling over in the photos. So if you go for brunch, make sure to ask for onion rings instead of assuming that it will come with it. I guess it's good I got salad to be on the healthier side, but I was kicking myself for not confirming that the burgers came with the onion rings. So consider yourself warned. The salad was just plain mixed greens with too much salad dressing.

All in all, a fantastic burger. The service was a tad on the slow side and I'm not sure why the people who sat down after us got their burgers before us (they had ordered the same thing, so maybe it got mixed up when the server brought it out?). There were also some gnats flying around which was distracting and a little gross. But 4.5 stars for one of the best burgers in SF. I'll definitely come back here again for this.
author: Christina L.

description:
I had to try the much talked about burger at Causwells.

I couldn't snag a popular weekend reservation time so I arrived early and had a drink at their bar while waiting for a table. The bartender was cool and super down to earth. 

A table opened up and we were promptly seated! The menu had a lot of appealing options. We went with the popular choices: deviled eggs and the burger. No sharing! Everyone got their own burger (with additional avocado and bacon because why not). Eggs were creamy. And the burger was so good. Thin patties, cheesy, juicy - delicious. The crispy thin onion strings were okay, they reminded me of a carnival. Probably could've skipped them entirely!  Definitely coming back even though it's a $$ burger.
author: Samantha L.

description:
After a couple months of hype and some shy away's from some extensive wait times we were finally able to sneak into Casuwells. 

After months of yelping and thrillisting their much adorned burger, I am sad to report at I was moderately underwhelmed. Note underwhelmed, not disappointed.

The brunch burger was the only option available. The bacon, the egg, the patty, were all perfectly cooked and married to the onion and pickle, but it was all rather one dimensional. Nothing screamed "this burger is special" to me. It tasted like a homemade big mac (which isn't necessarily a bad thing). It's just that I expecting an epically awesome throwback to your flat-top grill 1950's diner kind of burger.

The deviled eggs were pretty good though, and the service was also quite good.

Good burger, just don't get your hopes up. Super Duper a couple blocks away is just as good.
author: Peter T.

description: I absolutely love this place!  I know they have an amazing burger that is a must try as I've heard, but weekend brunch really does it for me!  Try the veggie hash with avocado - trust me you won't be disappointed!  The smoked cauliflower is...to. die. for!!
author: Kevin V.

description: Was on Chestnut street to meet up with a friend and happened upon this place.  One of the best hamburgers I've ever had, will be back.
author: Heather G.

description:
~ Causwells That Endswells ~

EATKING

Let us from dish to dish this story know,
To meat the even truth in pleasure flow.

To DINNERA

If thou be'st yet a fresh CORNBREAD flour,
Choose thou thy entree, and I'll pay thy dower;
For I can guess that by thy ICED TEA aid
Thou keep'st a menu herself, thyself hangrayd.
Of that and all the PORK RIBS, more or less,
Resolvedly more courses shall express:
All yet seems well; EXTRA RARE RIB EYE so meat,
The dessert menu, unwelcome is the sweet.

Feedish

EATALOT
author: Dan B.

description: I went here with my cousin and her 2 girlfriends and I was so impressed! We sat outside in February and the weather was just so beautiful! I got the waffles and they were so delish! The vibes here are so nice especially with the outdoor seating and just a walk away from the Palace of Fine Arts to burn off all those calories!
author: Kruti M.

description: Very underwhelming, particularly after reading reviews. Burger was way too much bun and not enough in between. Side salad tasted as if it was tossed several hours prior. Service was dreadful-- I had to basically drag a waiter to our table in order to place an order after patiently waiting for a solid 10 minutes. They serve 2 proteins, ground beef patties and chicken, and somehow out of the latter by noon...seriously??
author: Alex B.

description:
Nice spot for a sunny afternoon if you get a table outside. Their burger with onion strings is very very good. No wonder everyone around us was ordering the burger, I mean everyone! The rest of the food was good but not as good as their burger.

The thing I didn't like so much was their bread pudding. The sauce is too liquid for my taste.

Will come back for the burger though :)
author: Nuno S.

description:
When I hear "best burger in America contestant," my ears perk up.
I picture it.  I salivate a little.  I put it on the list.

SF has several best burgers.  Zuni, Nopa, & Spruce are the classics.
Then there's Marlowe, Mason Pacific, ABV, Rickybobby, Bartlett Hall, The Tradesman, 4505 Meats, & Tony's.

Yes, Tony's Pizza in North Beach makes a simply & utterly DIVINE hamburger.  That guy...

So eagerly I booked Causwells to try for myself this latest addition to the City By The Bay's Best Burger landscape.

My expectations were high.  I know this is a mistake, since then you are just setting yourself up for disappointment.  Expect nothing!  

But who can really do that?  

My expectations were high.

We were promptly greeted & seated for our early reservation.

Our server was great.  Nice, upbeat, efficient.

The food...

Deviled eggs.
Spare ribs.
The burger.

The deviled eggs were good, but honestly nothing you haven't had before.  You get 3 different varieties.  One classic, one w avocado mousse & toasted farro, one w smoked trout.  The star was the toasted farro.  What a unique & fabulous touch.

The spare ribs...
All the right stuff; cooked well & tender to the bone.  But the sauce, while good for sure, lacked in depth of flavor.  The accompanying coleslaw was fresh & light, w a citrusy tang.  Not heavy or drowned in a watery or mayonnaise based dressing.  

Now, the reason we came...
The Burger.
Aesthetically it is rather magnificent.  It's simply & classically done, not overridden w toppings that could be included in a brunch Bloody Mary & considered a meal.  

It was also cooked perfectly; neither underdone or overdone.  Kudos for this.

But taste wise?  It was very good.  But we both agreed that it didn't seem to be "best in the country" good.  That's an awfully big distinction.

Service, from the hostess & waiter to the bus boys, was top notch.

Solid.

3 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Their brunch burger was great and surprisingly filling. Friendly service and not much of a wait on a late Sunday morning. Perfect for grabbing a casual bite after walking around in Crissy Field (ok maybe a bit of walking)
author: Hanyu Q.

description:
Though almost all unexceptional, the myriad of restaurants on Chestnut make it possible to be seated immediately & without a reservation during Sunday's prime brunching hours. We chose Causewells as our post-retail therapy meal; the sidewalk tables and quaint window seating (where we ended up dining) looked most inviting. 

Their burger, called one of the best ones on multiple websites & publications, was decidedly not so according to my brunch partner. 

We shared deviled eggs (I picked the smoked salmon off of my halves); I'd call them ordinary, unspectacular, yet properly salted & seasoned (you'd be surprised how many bland deviled eggs I've come across since I started eating them not too long ago.) 

Though I prefer salsa rojo, I didn't have faith that the restaurant could handle a request for it, so I settled for their salsa verde chilaquiles. Why'd I order it then? Oh you haven't heard that chilaquiles is like sex? Even bad chilaquiles is good chilaquiles. Causewells' version was decent, but I probably wouldn't order it a second time. And, though Causewells was decent for brunch, I probably wouldn't go back a second time!
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Love this place! So glad we found this place for dinner after spending some time at nearby Chrissy Park. 

First of all, the atmosphere is great. It's a well designed/styled place where you can come casually dressed and have a laid back meal. Dim lighting/candles, great music (remixed Phoenix and Ellie Goulding), marble countertops and tables. Sometimes it's just nice to be casual at a nicer restaurant. They also did a good job with maximizing the space they have. The intimate table set up just works for them. 

As for the food, also great. Farm to fork, not surprisingly. We chose to sit at the bar to avoid waiting for a table. The bar is awesome, full service. We started off with the corn bread for the appetizer. It was rich and moist and had a layer of herbs baked in. Very tasty. For dinner, I got the boneless short ribs with roasted vegetables...very flavorful and tender. I was incredibly pleased with the meal (and service too). You can also have any of the menu items served family style...great for sharing. 

I read that they also make an incredible burger and donut bread pudding. I will definitely stop by again when I'm in the area. Highly recommended!
author: Rosalie N.

description: This is a small restaurant, easily missed but the food is amazing. Compliments to the chef.
author: Ebony J.

description: Ok France toast, the worse salad ever- came out from the kitchen with rotten lettuce!!!!! Disgusting!
author: Anat S.

description:
Corn soup - 2/5
Cornbread - 4/5 - Nontraditional. Light and herby. Could use honey butter instead of regular.
Carrots - 5/5 - Pistachio and mint went well together with the olive vinaigrette. 
Baby back ribs - 3/5 - While the sauce was unique, it really wasn't to my liking. Very tender though. 
Burger - 5/5 - Really solid burger all around. Patty had good flavor, crumbly and intentionally medium well. Added bacon and avocado. Good bun. Instead of a side they give you a mountain of really tasty fried onion strings which you can treat as both fries and a topping. Normally this burger would be an for me but the onions add an extra point here.
Donut bread pudding - 5/5 - Exactly what it sounds like but it also comes in a small pool of nutmeg milk. Very unique and very good.

Overall, for a number of their dishes Causwell's is "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Came in at around 1pm on a Friday afternoon and was immediately seated inside. My bf and I came to see what the whole burger hype was about and was shocked to see that there were only three choices under the "sandwich" section of the menu. :( we ended up ordering the grill chicken and salmon sandwich. 

Though I would definitely not consider this a burger joint (more of a side order/small plates type of feel), I was surprised at how tasty the sandwiches were! Each dish even came with a side order of mixed greens. Overall, both the sandwich and the greens had an interesting lemon/zesty taste which was not what I was expecting at all!

If you're in the marina district, and you should be every now and then, pop in to try it out for yourself! Theres even a bar seating area if you're in the mood for afternoon booze.

PROS:
-good portion size
-outdoor seating
-welcoming staff

CONS:
-bit on pricier side
author: Mary L.

description:
Very good burger!  Well-seasoned patties that due to some good decision-making on what to/not include stays together and is pleasant to eat.  The onion rings side make for a more enjoyable meal than fries since they are not as filling.  A bit pricey even for The City.  Super-fast service, pleasant server, good list of bottled beers, limited draft selection, and for those traveling through, it is only a block off 101.  

I like burgers but don't get all excited about them like some people hence my 4 stars.  If I go again, will definitely get the bacon next time.  

Comfortable and casual decor that works with jeans or a suit.  If you are a burger fanatic, I think the experience is worth the price.  But, $55 with tip for two burgers, a soda pop, and a bottle of beer is getting up there.
author: Mike S.

description:
If you're looking for a burger in San Francisco you should definitely try out Causwells.  It's a very informal setting but a great place with friendly service, awesome food and some good alcohol options.

We came here with some friends and we shared the brussels spouts to begin with.  It was a deceivingly large portion in a small bowl.  Then we all had the burger and everyone enjoyed it along with the string onions.

Great place for a date night or dinner with friends in a casual atmosphere.
author: Blake B.

description:
Fabulous brunch burger and onion rings, also excellent skirt steak. They have coke, but fake diet coke which is weird and even tasted weird. I like my diet coke!
Food - really good!
author: Nigel J.

description:
Been here twice now, and got the same thing both times! The burger is always amazing (add bacon and avocado, seriously). Also - their deviled egg appetizers! It feels like a lot to spend on deviled eggs but their smoked flavor makes them the best I've ever had. 

* Pro tip: you can order the burger at brunch!
author: Ellie J.

description: Great new place! Must have their burger and any of the desserts!! Great environment for singles, couple and family! It is a smaller restaurant and fills up fast so make reservations!
author: Elle P.

description: Me and some friends came for some light apps which were alright, nothing special. I thought their hush puppies with the ranch-like sauce was pretty good. My friend wanted to try their kale salad but it was eh. This place is pretty small but just right for what it is. I like the intimacy here and the dim lighting. I would recommend this place for a good quiet night out in the city. It's perfect for those wanting to avoid the long lines and reservation joints.
author: Allister D.

description: Five stars for the burger & onion straws alone. If you get anything else here, you did it wrong. Best burger i've had in SF, hands down.
author: Abigail S.

description:
The biggest plus: probably the best "fancy" burger in San Francisco. 
I just ate a burger at Marlowe last week, and the one I ate at Causwell's was better.

The burger I ate at Causwell's: It tasted like it had been seared in a cast iron pan... The sear/crust was very flavorful, and there was clearly an excellent blend of seasoning in the meat. The pickled onions and greens were outstanding, and the cheese was perfect. The bun was moist and fluffy with a bit of crust on the outside, and only added to the dish. I really, really enjoyed it. 

I eat burgers very infrequently these days, and when I decide to eat one at a place where it's a hyped specialty, I'm often disappointed. That definitely wasn't the case at here. I loved it.

The seared trout with sunchokes was also delicious (although it did pale in comparison to the burger). Again, it had a perfect crust. I want to know what brand of cookware they use.

The small apps were excellent, especially the kale salad. 
I've been here a few times now, and have never been disappointed.

Service is quite attentive, and the staff is knowledgeable. They have a unique selection of wines by the glass and craft beers.

I won't say this is a five-star experience, but if I have a craving for a burger in the near future, I will definitely go straight to Causwell's.
author: Angelo B.

description:
Omggggggggggggg.
The buuuuurrrrgggggeeeerrrr.
With the fried onion thingies.
And the beet salad.
And the doggies outside.
And the service.
Omgggggggg.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I wanted to love Causwell's because I LOVE Flour and Water (I know, highly contested amongst many), but unfortunately, my brunch experience was disappointing. On the positive side, they take reservations on OpenTable, the food was affordable, the space is nice and open and the service was very friendly. 

* DEVILED EGGS ($6.25) - 3.5 STARS:
This side is served with 3 half eggs with three different fillings: classic, avocado, smoked trout. The avocado and classic tasted essentially the same, very standard. But I enjoyed the smoked trout!

* FRENCH TOAST BITES ($11.50) - 2 STARS:
French toast bites, brandy sauce
Interesting, very crunchy and a bit dense and soft in the inside, but too heavy for my taste. 

* OMELETTE ($11.75) - 2 STARS: 
Farm fresh omelet,pork belly,sweet onion, potato, provolone
I tasted zero pork belly. It basically was a regular egg omelette with a tiny bit of chopped pork and some cheese.

* BURGER ($14.50) - 3 STARS: 
Brunch burger, egg, bacon,aioli
Patty was tasteless, yet the cheese was very salty. The bun was standard and tasted store bought.
author: Jess C.

description:
This burger is that fire boiiiii!  Come through here for a top 5 burger in the bay.  I would describe it as a fancy in n out style burger.  Comes with onion strangs that also leave me hootin and hollerin.

In all seriousness, this burger spot is worth the trip.  Support the local theater next door too, always have the A grade flicks!
author: Barry K.

description: This place has a creative and unique vibe. I loved the burger (come prepared to eat a lot), and our waiter was super helpful. However, I will say the dinner/happy hour menu is small.
author: Jenny H.

description: Day trip to the city and stopped here for lunch. Messy burger I felt bad ruining the white napkins lol but I'm sure the people won't mind that because it's a sign that  I genuinely enjoyed the food. it's a cute spot tucked in next to a theater. I loved it. There were about a few people there at the bar just chatting it up with old friends. It added a nice touch to a new place I've never been.
author: Ashley C.

description: Causwells was definitely our favorite dining experience on this Bay Area trip.  Many of the reviews hyped up their burgers, ricotta cheese dish and bread pudding dessert.  My wife and I decided to split all three and they were great.  The burger was my favorite and I recommend adding avocado and bacon.  Was also a huge fan of the bread pudding and the ricotta was tasty too.  A little rich for me but what makes this a five star rating was the service.  First off, Tom who is one of the owners was working the room making sure everyone was having a good experience.  Coupled with his extensive wine knowledge and polite disposition, it was a real treat to visit with him and he's the type of person you're going to pull for to be successful.  We also loved our server Frankie.  She was fantastic and we loved her personality.  We were of course additionally partial when we learned she grew up in Minnesota.  This restaurant is a really cool part of the Marina, has great food and exceptional service.  If you're looking for a pretentious place I would suggest you go elsewhere.  If you want great food and service, I would highly recommend Causwells.  All the best Tom!
author: Luke F.

description: Ordered food for delivery from them from post mates, and the only thing I was excited about after I was informed that the mushroom toast was 86'd, was the octopus that I replaced it with. The post mate called to inform me that they were out of the salad I ordered, so I got the chopped salad instead. The carrots and chopped salad were disappointingly bland, and the octopus never even made it into the bag even though I was charged for it. I've never eaten here, so maybe it's unfair of me to write this based on a to go order, but I'm not rating their service or ambiance, just the flavor of the food. Would never come here to eat.
author: Heather U.

description: Came here for the Americana Cheeseburger, left here absolutely pleased and wanting more. Usually the burger comes with 2 meat and 2 cheese, but I of course upped the ante and went for a 3 meat and 3 cheese! I should have went 4x4, in n out style. Burger patties cooked to perfection, right amount of sauce, and the perfect condiments. I also had 2 beers to wash the burger down, and also enjoyed the Hush Puppies before the burger. You can tell what my appetite & metabolism is like. lol. Quite honestly one of the best burgers I've had in a long time, and I worked at In n Out for 2 years!
author: John M.

description:
Relatively new, this brunch place was a definite catch. 

I ordered the pork hash with an over easy egg and added avocado as well. The pork was soft and delicious! A tad too much potato, so I was full very quickly. 

One of my girlfriends ordered the biscuits and gravy. The gravy was amazing. Paired with scrambled eggs, perfect combination for the morning brunch. 

My other friend ordered the brunch Causwells burger which tasted very rich and dense but she loved it. 

Would come again, but I'd like to try their dinner menu!
author: Kristi L.

description:
4.75

When a planned 8 mile hike turns into an unexpected 14 mile hike and the only snacks we had were opened bags of almost finished jerkey, huckleberry licorice, onion ring chips, 7 Ritz crackers, and a plum, we were famished.  I wanted something meaty but trying a new restaurant is always fun so I'm glad this place was suggested.

Arugula Salad - Refreshing, light, easy on the dressing, delicious
Deviled Eggs - The salmon, paprika, and mustard were all very subtle but together, it created something magical
Hush Puppies - These were decent.  Comes with a plate of 5 but I would've been content with 1
Crispy Potato - Nice crispy exterior, soft buttery interior
Cornbread - A bit dry, pass 
Burger - Juicy, moist, lots of flavor.  Crispy onions were a nice touch; it went well with a lot of the other dishes

Good food, good service.
author: Linda N.

description:
Came here for brunch around 1pm today and got seated outside right away (2 ppl, 2 dogs). This cute restaurant is on the small side, so can see it getting packed earlier and having to wait. 

I got the infamous Americana burger and it didn't disappoint. This thing was huge! Two patties, cheese, sauce, lettuce, onions & pickles. The Bun was really good, and the meat was tender/really tasty. It came with a side salad too. 

Everyone sitting around us seemed to get the deviled eggs and they looks really good too. 

I would def recommend coming to this spot if you are craving a good burger! I would love to come back to try the other entrees too because everything looked delicious!!
author: Samantha G.

description:
Best French toast EVER! 
I came here for Sunday brunch after hearing that their burgers are to die for. So my friend got a burger and I got the French toast since our server said we should get that. 

After each bite of the French toast I kept saying it was the best French toast I've ever had and would make the mmmmmm sound after each bite. The French toast was in cubes instead of the normal large pieces of toast. And the outside was crispy and inside moist and soft. It was perfection. Thinking about it makes me want to go to causwells right now! They also add slices of nectarine on top which goes hand in hand with the sweetness of the syrup. 

Let's not forget about the burger! If you like runny eggs, this burger's buns and patty fit nicely with a sunny side up inside. My friend and I left super happy. I give it 10/10 for brunch. 

I've also been for dinner and overall really good but not as amazing as the brunch.
author: Rohenne L.

description:
I am so in love with Causwells it's dangerous.  Not only is the food amazing, but the service is impeccable.  Everyone here truly cares about your experience.

Last night I tried the deviled eggs.  The one topped with smoked trout was my favorite!!  I also devoured the house made ricotta with honey.  (So good I scraped the plate!! Don't tell my mother!)
author: Chloe M.

description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. The side of crispy strings are really delicious. Also got the sweet potato and the carrot sides which were great. The staff (other than the very rude hostess) was awesome! Such a cute atmosphere too
author: Molly O.

description:
We love this place! We were really late coming in for our reservation on a super busy Friday evening, but the hostess was kind and courteous. The place is informal.small.cozy and very inviting.
The hush puppies and ricotta cheese made for great appetisers. The flounder was Fantastic!! Perfectly crisp on the outside and tasty soft inside. The prime rib was delicious. For dessert, the chocolate mousse is okay, bread pudding is good.
Fairly good selection of wines by the glass.
author: Sridevi K.

description:
We went here for brunch today, we had set a reservation so getting a seat was no problem. Their space was pretty small and it was busy when we arrived, what made it difficult was that people were standing all over the place which made it a bit of a hassle to get to our table. Even being quite crowded, it never got too noisy. 

Our waitress was extremely nice, and she seemed on top of everything. Their iced tea was really good, and we enjoyed their house made ricotta, it was probably my favorite item there, though it was pricey for the amount we had gotten. 

I ordered the brunch burger and added avocado, but to simply put it, I didn't enjoy it and it was too pricey for the quality given. There was barely any avocado, and there was a ton of aioli. The patty seemed overcooked and the bun was kinda cold... It was quite the messy burger, and it fell apart. And the side salad that came with my burger was bland. 

So, I would definitely come back for the house made ricotta, service, and iced tea, but I probably wouldn't order a burger again, I would just have to try something else.
author: Aiko H.

description: Overall a really big disappointment. I would give 0 stars but the app doesn't allow that.
author: Satu S.

description:
Took us over an hour and a half to get basic orders - burgers and butter noodles for a kid. And when asked why we were told it's because they got an influx of to go orders. This is completely absurd to prioritize to go orders over in restaurant customers. Ones with a little kid at that. A terrible customer service strategy and for that reason I do not recommend visiting them. 

BUT the burger was really good
author: Lindsey B.

description: Bomb! Salmon and Americana burger. Super noms! Small place small menu. Awesome service!
author: Kyle T.

description:
We arrived at Causwells after running the Nike Half Marathon thinking, well it's close by and fairly well rated. So let's go! But overall...I wished we didn't come here. Efficiency and effectiveness is not their forte for service and their food was just ok. I won't be coming back for sure.

Parking - Well we actually walked from the Presidio as the bf had already found parking there as he waited for me and my friends to finish running our half marathon, but parking will be tough as it's all street parking.

We arrived and they basically told us half an hour...it was not half an hour. After seeing two open 2 table seats they couldn't just ask the people who just sat down to move so that we could get a 4 person table..no no no, they said, the table next to one of the open 2 person tables would soon be out as they already had their bill. Well news flash, they were taking their pleasant time talking and didn't even look at their bill or put any kind of payment. So instead of the easiest solution, the hostess did nothing. We waited another half hour for another group to leave to finally get seats. We were already ready to order and get going, but it took more time for the waitress to get to us to order. I wanted to die. I was so hungry. Our burger was juicy and delicious and the donut bread pudding was a downer cause it was spiced and not so great. Also got the waffles with seasonal fruit but was disappointed when it came as their seasonal fruit were some pomegranate seeds...Did I mention there was no water refill the whole time?

Even if the food was mind blowing, I don't think I'd ever come back again just because of how we were treated. But if you do go, make sure to get reservations because others who came after us, just sat right away due to it.
author: Carolen M.

description: LOVE! Lovely neighborhood vibe with kind and sociable service. Wine selection is superb and the beer choice on tap, though limited, is impeccable! If you're in the mood for food they have great options for the small plates (deviled eggs and hush puppies are some go 'tos), and the burger is city famous while brunch chilaquiles are worth getting up and out for early!
author: J K.

description: Too expensive for what it is, and BAD service. I'm here right now. Stood in the doorway a few minutes and finally sat myself. Got handed a menu then completely ignored for 10 minutes. Finally started looking up reviews of other nearby spots when they finally took my order. Checked on once, but have now been waiting for anyone to be around at all to bring me my check for like 15 minutes with a dirty empty plate in front of me and empty glass. If I'm paying this much I'd like better service than say, a Subway, which didn't happen. Bummer.
author: Hallie T.

description:
4.5 from me! This was a truly great burger, yummy fried onion side dish, and even the brand of organic ketchup they served with it was amazing. (goodbye Heinz!)  Great service also aaaaand I could sit on the patio with my dog! The sweet server brought over a cup of water for my dog without me even asking. They didn't put enough sauce on the burger (and it was a little runny), but otherwise fabulous!

Yum!!!
author: Jen B.

description:
I'm still on the hunt for a GREAT burger in the city and I thought Causwells would be the solution to my #firstworldproblems. The burger looks great on many food bloggers instagram accounts BUT to my disappointment i was let down.

at $14 a pop the burger was juicy but very unforgettable. The only thing i remember was paying $14 for a burger with salad on the side??! I wonder if i could have gotten potatoes instead? 

Great customer service and atmosphere. Smaller than i thought it would be. Great mimosas (not unlimited).

i probably wont come back here again.
author: Carol Y.

description: I'd give the restaurant a 5 star rating if the service was a bit more prompt. They were not busy. I had a brunch burger  with all the fixings, and it was luscious. Others had salads with steak and thought the steak could have been less chewy. Nice location and outside tables for the sunny days of late. I would recommend it. If you are in a hurry- let the server know ahead of time.
author: Diane A.

description:
Regardless of whether you agree with them or not, the Marina lives up to its stereotypes. It's especially the place to be seen on Sunday morning. Everyone is either coupled up or in all female packs. Dressed up as always. 

We strolled down Chestnut, passing decorative storefront boutiques and the curious once over by our fellow peers. Reaching the other end of Chestnut, we decided to try Causwells for brunch, as there were some open tables and I had enjoyed dinner here recently. We sat at the window and ordered the pastrami hash with a fried egg (the menu is full of options if you're in the mood for eggs) and I chose the French toast bites. The eggs were on point and the French toast was delicious, but more like sugary, cinnamon donut bites than French toast. 

The service here was gracious and attentive. It's obvious that they care about their customers. The inside is sleek and modern with a mix of high and low table tops. You get the Marina look with a more relaxed, quieter vibe.
author: Shira W.

description: Service was decent. The burger was pretty good. Liked that the patties were thin. They were super greasy if you like that. The toppings were simple flavored and not too overpowering. I came here to try the burger as its been on the list of best burgers in the city for a while... It's good but nothing to give me a craving to come back. And how do you have a burger and not have fries? Big thumbs down from the purists.
author: Piper W.

description: Delicious food-ricotta is a must,  beer and wine only...meh, atmosphere and service were somewhat lacking.
author: Amanda M.

description: Such good food and the cutest atmosphere! I've been here twice and the waitstaff has always been very accommodating of large groups. I would recommend trying to make a reservation though because they can get quite busy.
author: Wyatt T.

description:
Came across this gem on Yelp while I was showing my friend around SF - you know, the usual touristy things like the GG bridge and Palace of Fine Arts, both of which aren't too far away from here. I tried to find a place that was "American" but also "San Franciscan".

He and I came at a weird time, so luckily avoided any kind of lunch or dinner rush. At first glance, the menu is a bit pricey, but that didn't stop us from wanting to try a bunch of things. Plus, since it's mainly tapas style, it made trying and sharing very easy.

Round 1: Deviled eggs. Comes with 3 different kinds, but you can also order all of one type or all or none or anything in between if you want. The salmon was definitely my favourite, then avocado, then classic. Classic wasn't bad, it's never bad IMO, lol, but the salmon definitely had a nice kick to it

In addition to the eggs, also had lavosh. Didn't really know what it was when I ordered it. Turned out to be cracker-like bread with ricotta cheese and honey. Simple fare, but probably m favourite of all the dishes tried! Is it bad to say I'm going to try making this at home now? lol

My friend and I also tried the octopus, mainly just so I could throw something new at him that he hasn't tried before. I've had octopus before at sushi restaurants, and I found this quite similar, except that it was cooked. It was good, but nothing particularly special I think, unless my palate was just adjusted to the other food by then.

Finally, there was the rainbow trout (cooked with skin, yummy crispy skin) and shrimp and grits. The shrimp and grits were my friend's favourite - I didn't notice in the description, but there was sausage or something in it as well (which I didn't mind, but my friend couldn't eat), so just FYI.

I would have liked to try one of their desserts too, but I think 5 dishes for 2 people was already pushing it, haha.

On top of the delicious food, the staff was fab - very friendly and attentive, and happy to give suggestions if you're feeling confused or overwhelmed... or just want suggestions. This place is a bit further than the usual neighbourhoods I hang out in, but I definitely think I'd come back to check out the area and, of course, to come back to Causwells ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
I'm writing this review as the first of my 2016 new year resolution to finally give back on Yelp! There was no doubt in my mind Causwells had to be my first review since I dine here at least once a week.

Diving right in, this is, bar none, the BEST burger I've ever had.

Before Causwells opened their doors my favorite burger in town was the Marlowe burger. That burger, served with its magical horseradish aioli, still has a special place in my heart (quite literally); however, the Causwells burger is now what I NEED to satisfy a burger craving.

In my opinion, a great burger starts with a fresh bun, and their seeded bun has the perfect amount of softness for allowing every bite to melt in your mouth. The sauce, onion and pickle combine as outstanding complements to the juicy beef patties topped with melted American cheese!

I could write an essay on the joy of taking the first bite into the most tender, flavorful burger you'll ever have, but it's just something you need to experience for yourself.

If I didn't make it clear enough, their burger is the all-star, but every dish I've eaten here has been fantastic! The staff and service have always been A+ as well.

*Side note: I recommend asking for a side of ketchup with the burger--they use an all natural brand named 'Sir Kensington's' that blows Heinz ketchup out of the water. I also recommend ordering the donut bread pudding if you have room for dessert!
author: Michael L.

description:
Yes, this place totally lives up to the burger hype. It's everything I want and more in a burger; the bun, the American cheese, the crispy bacon, the sauce, complete perfection. 
However, paying $18+ is not the most ideal price especially for lunch. $4 for onion straws...I'm getting robbed. 
The price is the only thing that detracts from my review but the burger was solid and I'll probably be back for another round. We also had the deviled eggs with smoked trout that were sinfully good. 
Overall, I was very pleased with the quality of the food and service. Everything seemed fresh and perfectly seasoned. Service was quick, friendly and efficient. 
I'll be back but I'll make sure it's on the week where I get paid.
author: Victoria T.

description:
Causwells gets 5 stars not for the burger but for being a class act. On my first visit, I can only give the burger 3 stars. My purpose for coming to Causwell's was specifically for the burger. I had read quite a bit about Causwells on my Zagat email, 7x7, and Bay Area Bites. All spoke highly of the burger. And since having a great ostrich burger in Napa, I thought it was time to check out a great beef burger.

 Let me state the meat was excellent, great texture and crust. The problem was a lack of seasoning, no salt ( burgers love salt). Further, the special sauce was not noticeable, at least not to me. Now clearly, every kitchen has their off days, but the burger is their signature dish, so consistency is key.

After finishing the burger, two ladies came up to me and asked me how I liked the burger? I told them It lack seasoning and I couldn't taste the sauce. Low and behold, one of the ladies was the owner. You know she took the burger off the bill. That was quite a surprise to me. Be sure, I would have been happy to pay for the burger. I actually felt guilty that I wasn't charged. Causwells is clearly a restaurant with Class.

Now let me get on my soap box for a minute and talk about the lack of consistencies in restaurants. Not just Causwells, but 90 percent of most of the restaurants around. The main problem is the kitchen staff. These days when I check out a restaurant I want to see the mix of the kitchen staff. If I don't feel comfortable about the staff, I normally move on. I have to say while sitting at the bar at Causwells, before receiving my burger,  looking into the kitchen, I wasn't super confident. But as stated earlier, it was probably an off day.

Understanding that cooking for the public is an exceedingly difficult task, it's crucial that restaurateurs hire people who have a love and passion for cooking. Unfortunately, most of the people on the line  (in the kitchen) look at their job as a chore, just labor. Thus,  inconsistencies.

Frankly, I've gotten to the point where I would like to see a posting on the restaurant window of those working in the kitchen along with their experience.

I will certainly return for another shot at the burger.
author: Anthony W.

description:
Had a wonderful lunch at this cool spot and would highly recommend.  The staff was very attentive and our order came out quickly! We had deviled eggs that were divine, hush puppies that were hot and fresh for appetizers. 

I had the burger with onion strings on the side--both were delicious and perfectly cooked.  My daughter had the salmon sandwich and it was amazing as well.  

Do yourself a favor and stop at this place for a fabulous lunch or dinner! The staff was extremely attentive and made sure everything was perfect!
author: Kristin M.

description:
Ok, I'll pile on... the burger was pretty good. The bun was excellent. Very fresh. 

The waitress told us it was ranked as one of the top 15 burgers in the country. That seems a little far fetched. It was good but I wouldn't put it that high but that's just me.
author: Lydia Z.

description: Very disappointed in the rancid smell of the burger that I had been anticipating for so long. Inedible.
author: Leslie M.

description: Fab burger! Everyone has their opinion on the qualities of a great burger. My preference is two thinner patties, basic toppings, melted cheese and a fresh great warm bun! So I think their burger is great, they serve it with these crisp thin onion rings. I have also tried other items on the menu they did not disappoint.
author: Natasha M.

description:
Generally overpriced other than the good beer selection, Causwells does indeed have a badass burger that is worth the price. 

As another reviewer mentioned, absolutely a classier-juicier-and-just-better version of the Inn N Out burger we all know and love. Served with really nice onion strings. 

Brussel sprouts w/ Bacon were on point too. 

Come for a low key date, split the burger and brussel sprouts, and go check out the sunseat at the nearby beach or walk around the Palace of Fine Arts. 

Great spot if you stay away from the pricier fare.
author: Salim Z.

description:
Ehhh... this is a 2.5 for me.  The food was decent for that American New style.  I had a pork hash that was a decent portion size and had good flavors.

We came right after the Nike Women's Half Marathon on a Sunday afternoon.  It took them over an hour to seat us, despite a 40 minute quote.  They did not give us compensation for waiting the extra half hour.  Also, they were seating really inefficiently.  While they had a waiting list and took reservations, when a large party didn't show, they gave the seats to another large (walk-in) party instead of seating the smaller reservations that had come first.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Great burger place! The customer service is awesome here. They seated us about 30 mins late but they were really apologetic and even gave us complimentary appetizer and drinks. 

The burger by itself was really tasty and super juicy. It was a pretty big portion as well. I was really satisfied after. 

Overall, really good burger spot with excellent customer service!
author: Paul U.

description:
Such a great dining experience from start to finish! It was my last night in San Francisco and I wanted to make sure we had an awesome meal. This spot certainly delivered. 

We opted to sit outside on this beautiful evening and from there, gorged ourselves in a way that I can only describe dish by dish... 

1) House made ricotta, rosemary honey, lavash - Forget the lavash, once that was I gone I was happily eating this cheese with a spoon. It was light, not too sharp and a perfect taste of things to come. 

2) Heirloom tomato, jimmy nardello pepper, melon vinaigrette, fried okra - These tomatoes tasted like they had been picked only seconds before. The vinaigrette was perfect and the fried okra added a nice change in texture. Another winner!

3) Americana burger, cheese, Causwells sauce, pickle, chips - We came on National Cheeseburger Day so it only seemed fitting to order a burger. We split it four ways and I think my whole table agreed we could have each ate a whole one ourselves. This was one of the best I've had in awhile. I don't know what Causwells sauce is but I want some more! 

4) Gulf white shrimp, house made andouille, cajun gravy, Anson Mills grits - A new kind of taste added to the mix! This is exactly what I want for breakfast. Every. Single. Day. 

5) Grilled octopus, garbanzo, fennel, chili - I'm an octopus fan and these were thick cut pieces that were perfectly grilled, soft and chewy. 

6) Chilled sweet corn, jimmy nardello peppers, goat cheese - This reminded me of a dish I make at home a lot. it was great but not necessarily a not-to-be-missed dish; however, if corn and goat cheese are your favorite foods, go ahead and get it.

7) Buttermilk biscuit peach short cake, pickled peaches, peach brandy sauce - The pickled peaches definitely made this dish unique. If you're not a big sweets person, this is a good dessert for you. If you do love a little sugar, opt for the next one... 

8) "All-Star" donut bread pudding, spiced milk - Ohmygoodness we're so full but can't stop eating this warm bread pudding. It's what dreams are made of. 

Looking back, I kind of can't believe we ate so many different things. YOSFO.*

The SERVICE. The entire staff was super friendly throughout. If you're ever worried about service being dead, just come here and your faith will be restored. Believe it or not, all of these small plates at up in price (ok, you probably can believe that). Even so, it's the kind of meal you won't feel bad paying a pretty penny for. It's worth it.

*You Only San Francisco Once (and that's a lie, I'll probably be back)
author: Cassie P.

description:
supposedly one of the best burgers in the city! came here on easter with a gf after attending easter service at canvas right next door (amazing church, people, and service..and im not even christian..anyhoo...) had a 1 pm reservations, but they were packed, so we waited about 10 minutes outside. it's a cozy little restaurant - good sized bar area and a 6-person communal table, and 2- and 4-tops in an adjacent dining room.. i probably wouldnt come here with more than 4 people...

brunch menu is simple to navigate, especially when your heart is set on trying the americana burger (although the brunch burger looked good too!)..but it was my first time, so lets stick with what theyre known for.  my gf got a bloody mary and i the salty dog - sake with grapefruit and salted rim. YUMMM! i could easily drink like 18 or 19 of these (but stuck with one).. so grown up!

waiting for the burger was agonizing, but it came out pretty quick!  and ohhmyyy is it BEAUTIFUL. 2 patties, cheese, causwells sauce, sesame bun - side of greens - i knew it was going to be delicious before i took a bite.  and then i took a bite, and couldnt stop eating it until it was gone :) we thoroughly enjoyed this meal!  service was a bit slow since it was so busy...
author: Christina L.

description: We really enjoyed our food at this great spot! We ordered an Americana burger, which my son loved, as well as the onion strings, which were also delicious! In addition, we had a grilled veggie sandwich which I highly recommend. Unfortunately, the service was ridiculously slow -- we waited almost 45 minutes for our meal with a dining room that wasn't half full. Overall, we'd probably try it again but would hope for better service!
author: Shana G.

description:
I came for the infamous burger as it's on quite a few top burger lists in SF..
It's a very solid burger, I'll admit that. But I don't think I would name it the top as I've had better. All subjective though!

It's quite hefty, could definitely have been two meals so if you think of it price-wise, it's pretty good! You can definitely share it and try something else if you're coming with another person. Since it's actually multiple thin patties stacked on top of each other, it's easier to eat and evenly cooked and still moist. They did well with bun choice (I love bread so I'm picky!) - if memory serves correctly, I believe it was a brioche bun (YAS) - which definitely held the burger (ugh, soggy, fragile burgers are the worst and thankfully it wasn't a problem here. Savory and delicious but not amaaaaaaazing, in my opinion.

I did like that it came with crispy fried onions (vs fries) but they weren't that flavorful or crispy, kind of a waste. Great for pictures though.
author: Emily C.

description: We went for brunch, very nice...trendy and delicious. Great double stack burger, wonderful omelette, coffee that is rich, tea in its own mini press. Friendly staff. Definitely go again.
author: Robert S.

description:
A cozy spot in the marina with an extensive list of beer and a pretty decent list of wine from Spain, Portugal, and California. 

We ordered the arugula salad, bavette, dirty rice with chicken liver, and Monterey squid. All of the dishes were solid: fresh greens, steak not overbooked, the dirty rice with chicken liver was surprisingly tasty.  Our favorite was probably the Monterey octopus which is tender, cooked just right, with a good balance of garbanzo beans and salad as complements. 

I had the Pinot noir by the glass (second from the top), quite good. Worth trying.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
So, Causwells was first recommended to me by a girl from OkCupid last week. Then, I came across it again while looking at Yelp's new businesses. And then, my friend and I happened to be getting ice cream sandwiches down the street, and figured we should probably eat a proper meal too. So, call it celestial guidance or whatever that led me here, but I'm glad it did!

Still being a bit full from our breakfast dessert (okay, fine, it was 4pm), we stuck with their small plates, which honestly sounded more interesting than their entrees anyway: 

* Rye Parkerhouse Rolls & Cultured Butter - I never order bread, because I feel like it's something that should come with the meal, so this was a bit of a luxury. The rolls came in a set of four, with a simple glaze on top, and what I think was sea-salted butter. Tasty enough on its own, but even better once I realized I could make mini sliders with the brisket!

* Housemade Ricotta & Lavash - I'm not usually one to order cheese plates, given the lactose intolerance and all. The ricotta was nice and smooth, with a tasty lemony zing to it, and went well with the fresh lavash crackers. If you run out (and you will, because there's a lot more cheese than cracker), bear in mind that you can ask for more.

* Steak Tartare - Having tried tartare at more and more places across the city, I've found that most of them share similarities in taste. Causwells', though, was pleasantly different: not as savory or (overly) salty as most places I've been to, but lighter and fruitier instead. This definitely needs to be eaten before the brisket, because the flavors of the tartare are subtle enough that the latter will have dulled your taste buds with the in-your-face flavor.

* Smoked Brisket - The star of the dishes we ordered, with great flavor (similar to corned beef) and a nice, tender texture. Be sure to eat it with all the extra sauces and accoutrements provided in the dish.

I definitely see myself coming back here, if not only because I want to try their deviled eggs and octopus!

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Another venue with mixed counter and regular table seating. Of the latter, some are placed in such a way as to not be accessible, but the majority should not prove to be an issue.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, but given their location in the back, you may have to ask the nearest table to get out of their chairs in order to squeeze by. I also seem to recall a divider that may make opening the door a little difficult.
author: Johnny W.

description: This was our first restaurant we visited in SF and wow we were not disappointed. The hubs and I sat at the bar and the service was amazing. I had a delicious Malbec and we ordered the deviled eggs for an app. We split the Birthday burger and the American burger. I don't usually order a burger but wow the birthday burger was the best!
author: B B.

description: To this date, the best burger I have had. After reading some reviews on here, I see others have discovered better ones, but I can not attest to those yet. I can say that this was a delicious mouth-watering burger with incredibly fried onions on the side. This place is small and packed though, so make a reservation and go make your belly happy.
author: Nikita K.

description: The menu is a little limited, but the Americana burger is amazing. Might be the best burger I've ever eaten. Seriously good. And the onion strings were great. You're paying $20 for a burger, but it was worth it.
author: Mike P.

description:
Causwells is located in a very beautiful part of town near the marina.  We came here for brunch on Saturday morning and were seated right away on the patio out front.  The server was very friendly and made our dining experience pleasant.    The breakfast burger was awesome, my husband bailed on his breakfast for half of my burger.  He had the 2 egg plate with bacon, potatoes, and 5 grain toast.  Our friend had the belgium waffles which he described as "perfect."  

Tip: order a mimosa and take time to walk down to the marina after your meal...delightful.
author: Monica J.

description: Brunch burger is probably better than the regular burger.  I had the regular burger just to compare it to The Company Burger, a burger joint in New Orleans.  These two were in competition with each other for Thrillist's best burger in America competition and apparently, the voters chose this.  I'd have to disagree though.  Whilst still a good tasty burger, I'd much prefer 4505 to this.  But if you're in the neighborhood it's still a nice spot.  Disappointed they don't serve French fries because that seems standard with a burger, but the side salad is a nice light addition to the meal.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I've heard so much about their burger amongst many things. It's true, their burger was delectable. Crispy edges of the patties with a healthy serving of pliable cheese in every bite cradled together by their lightly toasted bun. Fried onion strings in replacement of fries, nice change. Friend ordered a bacon add-on (1.50), why did I decide to save the calories?! Bacon made the burger even better! 

Ordered shishito peppers $7-8. Small order that was baked or grilled, not bad. I'll try the deviled eggs next time! 

We ordered 2 beers, 1 wine, 2 burgers, peppers. The bill came close to $70. 

Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. No noses were up in the air while be served. One unfortunate mishap tho, kitchen forgot to add onions and lettuce onto my burger so I snatched some of my friend's. 

Such a fun restaurant, I like the street patio seating, inside's a little loud for me. Can't wait to come back!
author: Margherita S.

description: Best burger of all time! Smash style- American cheese. Delicious.
author: Samantha I.

description:
I'm not sure what the fuss is about to garner such rave reviews for the place. Still searching for a romantic date spot in the Maria that actually serves good food. I came here with the hubby on a Saturday night and the experience was underwhelming.

We shared the octopus, the steak tartar and deviled eggs and split the burger as our entree. The highlight was the deviled eggs trio, otherwise, the food is average. It wasn't bad, nor was it memorable. Move along, nothing to see here...
author: Alice W.

description:
Packed on a Friday night, I had the honor to dine here for a beautiful, decked out 5 course meal with wine pairing. The service is excellent here. The general manager was super sweet and gave us complimentary house made ricotta spread on chips. Our server was cool and professhh! The food was overall delicious. I would probably go with my own wine choice next time, than do the pairing but it was a nice experience. 

The recommendations:
-- Burger is amazing! Yes, I said it. It's the classic all American cheese burger w/ American cheese, 2 juicy patties, soft white sesame bun, and a side of onion strings! Pricey but worth it! 
-- Trout was super homey and hit the spot. I loved the crunchy skin texture of the fish. It was served over beans, tomatoes, and savory broth. Very well done! 
-- All-star donut bread pudding was so delicious. It tastes like a warm cinnamon toast crunch bread over milk. Definitely hit my sweet tooth craving for sure! 

Amazing service! Girls night out spot. Date night worthy. Or even dine alone at the bar solo for some am quality me-time. Overall, great ambiance for a causal fun meal that fits any agenda.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Lights out - a must do in the Marina. Take a look at the menu, sure, but you're getting the burger. Lezzz be honest.

Ranked as one of the Top burgers in the country by Thrillist - https://www.thrillist.com/eat/nation/thrillist-s-best-new-burgers-2014

If you're visiting, check out a Fort Point brew on tap
author: Jarrett H.

description:
Love the Americana burger. 

Something about the heaping pile of crispy onions and perfectly toasted sesame buns was just so very satisfying. It's shareable, but if you're feeling adventurous, then have at it. You'll have no regrets. 

Also really enjoyed the ribs and the crisp beers on what was a rare warm SF evening. 

Cool, chic spot. Awesome burger.
author: Linda X.

description: Great ambiance, service and food! I was hesitant to come here because the menu seemed plain and small but I'm so glad we came! It was truly a great experience.
author: SAnne H.

description: Great people work here! I am gluten free and they were very attentive to me. It would be great if they had a few more options for gluten free people because my friends and family love this place. Just a bit underwhelming for me. Crossing my fingers for next time!
author: Caitlin M.

description: The burger tastes like salt and pickles. the meat was tender, but I would not go as far as saying it is the best burger in SF. The fries were cool, but not yummy, tastes like fried stuff. The waitress were nice. take out order was pretty fast.
author: Stacey T.

description: The restaurant is very small but the food is very good. The America burger is outstanding and big enough to share between two if you are not extremely hungry. Both fries and onion strings are delicious. There is low lighting and the tables are rather close together too.
author: Tyler V.

description:
I have been here twice now and see myself coming back again. A friendly staff with good food is what you should expect from here. 

The burger is very good. Two patties cooked to perfection with sesame covered buns and a thousand island sauce that keeps it all together. I wouldn't call it the best burger in town but it is still good. Comes with deep fried onions which were also very good. Perfectly Crunchy and very tasty. 

The grilled octopus is what I must rave about though. Incredibly tender and full of flavor. I have not had octopus with this kind of texture before and it is perfect. 

I did have a slip up recently when they forgot one of my orders and was unattended for a while. Mistakes happen, and they ended up comping my drinks to make up for it. 

In the end, I like their food which is all that really matters to me. So I'll be back.
author: Bryant C.

description: Precious little place, service was cheerful and quick. Good beer selection. Deviled eggs were awesome. House made ricotta not to be missed. Wanted to lick the plate. Brunch burger was perfect in every way.  Maybe a little loud inside. I'd certainly try to score one of the outside tables. It's a great neighborhood spot.
author: Jeffery M.

description: I came to Causewells for a brunch date and was not disappointed! Causewells is an amazing place to go for a nice Sunday brunch! The menu has great options and their coffee is so good! I recommend this place 100%! I've heard they have really good dinners as well!
author: Valeriia K.

description:
This was an unexpected find: we had no reservations, party of 4, and no wait! It's a small place though, so perhaps this is a rare feat for a Sunday evening. 

The plates vary in sizes, from the annoyingly sparse (duck confit) to the generous entree. I recommend just asking questions of your waiter to determine the best fit for your group and price point. 

I was a bit irked that the wine list format made it hard to know that the wine we ordered was a blend, and almost sent it back because the label didn't match the menu name. I wasn't sure whether the sommelier meant this, but it seemed kinda dishonest to present a blend as the pricier Grenache grape that only made up 10% of it. 

This wasn't a cheap meal, but was probably a bit more affordable than A16 across the street and pretty tasty. If I were regularly in the neighborhood, I'd definitely return.
author: Krista L.

description: Food was so terrible. We were hungry but we couldn't really eat it because it just tasted awful. Ordered the Chicken Linguini and the Shrimp and Grits and couldn't finish either. We also ordered the hush puppies and while those were edible and we did eat them, they were just passable. I would never trust them again for a meal after trying three dishes ranging from lackluster to inedible. Service and ambiance were fine though, so there's that?
author: Emily K.

description: Tasty burger patty and happy with the service! Sat at the bar and food came hot and quick. Americana burger had great flavor, though my bun was served rather soggy (it's a juicy patty), and the side salad needed some inspiration as it sat as mixed greens with some vinaigrette.
author: Braden F.

description:
I'm giving this spot 5 stars based on the burger 

Jesus wept it's like in and out slipped into some lingerie and invited us into the bedroom ..

It's that good 

The fries or whatever they are ( maybe onion ?) are next level and you really need to wash it down with a few beers.

Top stuff I will come again and again - only I don't live here so you should come instead.

In a word ... King Kushdy
author: Mark G.

description:
I am impressed how much attention the owner imparts into the selections of his restaurant menu. The food is made with fresh products and have a unique taste. 

The Americana Burger served with onion strings is what I really wanted to try.

If you have ever tasted shake shack burgers you will be surprised that the Americana Burger taste superior. Don't get me wrong I love shake shack.

The Americana Burger is unlike any other burger I've ever tasted. The meat is charboiled yet juicy. The bread has great flavor almost like pretzel bread but better and softer. The onion strings were really good.

I'm not an alcoholic drinker, so I ordered ginger ale made with real ginger (beverage company from brooklyn). I was told that on the weekends for brunch they have a few selections of freshly squeezed juices.

Don't go anywhere else in SF for a burger, head to Causwells !
author: Joel V.

description:
Visited on a Sunday around 130 pm for brunch. Seated immediately and the service was prompt, attentive, and friendly. Add to that a great wine-by-the-glass list, beers on tap, and Mimosas with your choice of fresh squeezed OJ or Grapefruit juice (just a splash, because if you're paying for alcohol, that should be the primary ingredient!), we are SO happy that The Tipsy Pig was too busy to seat us.  

The menu is full of great options. The server even offered some of their dinner plates as an alternative, even though they were still serving brunch. We ordered the Braised Pork Hash, Brunch Burger, deviled eggs, and the Romaine Salad with smoked trout. All delicious !!! I must return to try the fresh ricotta and donut bread pudding!!!
author: Arlene P.

description:
Causwell's was an amazing find!  The food was incredible, the service was great, and the ambiance was laid-back and pleasant.

My friend and I ordered way too much food, but it was all delicious!  We loved the deviled eggs and the ricotta with honey served with lavosh - both starters were very flavorful.  Our other favorites were the burger (juicy and bursting with flavor) and kale salad.  We also enjoyed the corn bread (quite rich) and creamed corn, though they weren't quite as good as the rest of the items.  We also found the alcoholic ginger beers quite refreshing.

The service was pretty good, and our waiter was friendly and attentive (and quite attractive, too!).

The space is pretty cool - the Art Deco elements are nice, and it has a cozy, casual, welcoming atmosphere. When we asked our dashing server if he knew about the design of the place, he shared some great secrets...like what the restaurant used to be, various design elements that were preserved, some secret passageways, and even more intriguingly, what the light shades used to be...!  (Be sure to ask...)

Great spot - I definitely want to return!  (Especially for the donut bread pudding that sounded amazing that we didn't have room in our stomachs for!)
author: Barnali D.

description:
Burger was as advertised--delicious!

Ricotta was also fantastic. 

Do not order the kale salad-- over dressed and came w cold, day old brussel sprouts. When I mentioned to our waitress it wasn't their best work she ignored me.  

Lastly, their brussel sprouts are a skip. Don't order. They're soft, and seemed to be steamed. How hard is it to get those right? You fry 'em up or sauté them until crisp. 

So much promise; felt underwhelmed and a lack of awareness. I should have been more direct about the quality of those two dishes.
author: Michael R.

description: Best burger in San Francisco, hands down. Thangyou.
author: Eric L.

description:
Originally tried Causwells via UberEats and it was delicious. My boyfriend and I anticipated it being soggy, but not at all. We loved it. Finally went to the restaurant and wow. 

Ordered
Ricotta - 3/5 this is pretty tasty, but don't think I would order it again. 
Deviled Eggs- 5/5 loved their deviled eggs. The smoked trout on top was so delicious. 
Burger- 5/5 One of my favorite burgers in SF. It is a good, classic cheeseburger. Super juicy, love the pickles, onion, and the meat has crispy edges. Seriously delicious. Don't come here and not try it. 

Do wish the burger came with fries. I know they don't want to take away from the burger, and the onion strings are delicious. But I am fries with my burger kind of gal.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: I heard their burger was one of the best so of course I wanted to try it! They are located in a more "out to see & be seen" area of SF down by the marina, the place is small, with a kind of deconstructed decor but the place was very comfortable. I started with a Headland's "day trip" tripel, very good! So now onto the burger....hmmm best way to describe this delectable burger is like this....it's everything a big mac could ever aspire to be using very fresh ingredients and top shelf meat & buns. It's a juicy double burger, cheese, onions, lettuce, pickle, special sauce on , yeah a sesame seed bun, and yes I am singing the song in my head :) OMG it's so good. Fried onions were good too,kind of addictive.There were some interesting items on the menu that I'd like to try, but being the 1st visit I knew it had to be the "burger" The staff was friendly, prices are in line with similar places, if you love burgers this is the place for you!!!!!
author: Karen R.

description:
We were looking for a good burger on our recent trip to S.F. and decided to give Causwells a try.  We walked in on a Sunday night and were seated right away.  The place has a nice cozy feel.  We tried the cheeseburger and it did not disappoint.  I read somewhere that it is like a pricier In n Out and I would not disagree with that assessment.

Bun:  Super tasty and light.  It is substantial enough to hold everything together, but doesn't overpower the burger with breadiness.

Patties:  It looks like you get two thin patties put together and this was genius in my book.  You get a really nice texture on the burger throughout each bite this way.  Sure, you don't get to choose your meat temperature, but I'm perfectly fine with that.  I'm going to try this at home as I think my grilling skills will improve.  :)

Cheese:  I think they use American cheese, which makes for the best cheeseburger in my book.

Veggies:  Fresh and tasty.

My son had the Hen of the Woods Mushroom dish and I thought that was pretty good as well.

We finished with the Pot de Creme and Bread Pudding desserts.  Super yummy way to polish off a not so healthy, but tasty meal.  :)

Was this place pricey?  Yes, but if you want to go out and eat a nice meal in a nice environment, then you will enjoy eating at Causwells.  I would not hesitate to return, if the opportunity presented itself.  ;)
author: Sam S.

description: Thank you Causwells for making the best cheeseburger that I have ever had! I ordered the Causwells cheese burger with bacon and avocado. It was huge and just absolutely amazing after a long morning of walking throughout San Francisco. Their special burger sauce was one of the reasons why this burger was so great. What really put the cherry on top of my amazing lunch was their shredded crispy onion rings which were also so great! It's a shame I'm not in San Francisco often or else this would be my go to burger spot.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
